298.description: Criminalizes the knowing and intentional failure of a physician, nurse, or other licensed medical person to provide reasonable medical care and treatment to an infant born alive as a felony.

299.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
299.title: Born-alive Infant Protection Act
299.description: Provides equal medicare for infants born-alive as a result of abortion procedure/natural delivery with violations subject to criminal penalties for medical personnel/loss of license/civil action for damages.

300.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
300.title: Relating To Criminal Offenses-disorderly Conduct
300.description: Makes threats of mass violence and false reports of threats to educational, religious, social institutions or civic or fraternal associations a misdemeanor.

301.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
301.title: Regulation Of Sales--identification Cards--anatomical Gifts
301.description: Requires applicant for drivers licenses and registry issued identification cards to complete the form provided by the DMV on organ donation.

302.title: Vital Records -- Adoption Of Children
302.description: Allows the division of vital statistics to provide an original birth certificate of an adult adopted person to the adopted person's lineal descendants or the legal representative of the adopted person if the adopted person is deceased.

303.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
303.title: Modernization Of Publication Of Legal Notices, Advertisements And Other Written Matters
303.description: Allows the publication of legal notices on the state's official website and a corresponding local newspaper satisfying the requirements for the publication of any statutorily-required notice, advertisement, or other written matter in a newspaper.

304.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
304.title: Public Notice Requirements Act
304.description: Authorizes municipalities to publish public notices in any newspaper in circulation in the municipality or on any other platform designated by ordinance.

305.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
305.title: Equal Opportunity And Affirmative Action - Disability Business Enterprises
305.description: Integrates employing more developmentally disabled workers in the workforce.

307.title: Zoning Ordinances--zoning Board Of Review
307.description: Authorizes the town of South Kingstown to enact a local ordinance which increases the number of alternates on their zoning board of review from two (2) to three (3).

308.last_action: House voted to recommit to House Municipal Government & Housing
308.title: Tax Sales
308.description: Require in-person bidding at tax sales.

311.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
311.title: Open Meetings
311.description: Open Meetings Act to allow virtual public meetings until July 1, 2022.

312.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
312.title: Covid-19 Vaccination Not Required For Access To State Or Private Businesses Act
312.description: Prohibits public agencies and private businesses from requiring proof of COVID-19 vaccine before permitting any individual from entering the building or business unless that business precluded access in common practice prior to COVID-19 pandemic.

314.title: Redistricting Of The General Assembly
314.description: Sets forth the boundaries of the voting districts for the House of Representatives and the Senate. Also sets forth the territory for the First and Second Congressional Districts in Rhode Island.

315.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
315.title: Corporations - General Provisions
315.description: Authorizes during declared emergency the issuance of emergency rules for corporate filings and minimum taxes.

316.title: State Building Code
316.description: Increases the levy on total construction costs that cities and towns may charge for building permits and directs that fifty percent (50%) each of the levy be transmitted monthly to the department of labor and training for workforce training.

318.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
318.title: Seizure Safe Schools Act
318.description: Requires the departments of elementary and secondary education and health to adopt policies/ rules/regulations for the administration of seizure rescue medications for children who have been medically identified as having epilepsy/seizure disorder.

319.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
319.title: The 2022 Transparency In Education Curriculum Materials Act
319.description: Requires that instructional or training materials used for faculty and staff training, and all learning or curricular materials used for student instruction, be displayed on the school’s website, in an easily accessible location.

320.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
320.title: Energy Facility Siting Act
320.description: Requires carbon-emissions-reduction goals be considered in energy plant siting proceedings.

323.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
323.title: State Aid
323.description: Provides PILOT to Exeter for state owned properties. Imposes no duty on Exeter to protect these properties. Requires payments to be used to create a police dept. or defray town expenses used to provide police protection.

324.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
324.title: The Rhode Island Early Childhood Innovation Act
324.description: Establishes the RI Early Childhood Innovation Act and authorizes department of human services to fund programs for at-risk kindergarten children of $1,000,000 annually.

326.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
326.title: Procedure Generally -- Fees
326.description: Increases the amount forwarded to Rhode Island Legal Services from court filing fees for the entry of every petition, complaint or action in district, superior and family court.

327.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
327.title: Fiscal Notes
327.description: Requires fiscal notes regarding legislation creating a new crime or increasing period of incarceration or modifying sentences.

329.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
329.title: Neurofeedback Therapy
329.description: Creates a two (2) year pilot program to provide insurance coverage for neurofeedback therapy for members of the military and veterans suffering from post-traumatic stress disorder and for individuals under the age of twenty-one (21).

331.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
331.title: Accessible Residence Modifications' Coverage
331.description: Requires health insurance plans to provide coverage for accessible residence modifications, where those modifications are medically necessary.

332.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
332.title: Minimum Wages
332.description: Commencing 1/1/23, gradually increases the minimum wage for employees receiving gratuities from the current ($3.89) to ($14.95) by 1/1/2027 and on 1/1/2028 the minimum wage shall be no less than the minimum wage established by the minimum wage law.

334.last_action: Referred to Senate Housing and Municipal Government
334.title: Regulation Of Rental Of Motorized Bicycles, Motor Scooters And Motorized Tricycles In New Shoreham
334.description: Allows the city of Newport to regulate motorized tricycles in a similar manner as the town of New Shoreham.

337.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
337.title: Bail And Recognizance
337.description: Prohibits the courts from setting cash or surety bail on any misdemeanor offense but would permit the court to set reasonable non-monetary conditions of bail to assure the defendant’s presence in court as required and to protect the community.

338.title: Identification And Apprehension Of Criminals
338.description: Provides for the sealing of court records without motion and by operation of law thirty (30) days after acquittal or exoneration of all counts in a criminal case.

340.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
340.title: Sentence And Execution
340.description: Provides additional factors that a court must consider in imposing a sentence on a criminal defendant.

341.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
341.title: Liens Against Causes Of Action
341.description: Prohibits a hospital from claiming a lien on any damages recovered by a Medicaid patient as a result of an accident not covered by workers' compensation.

345.title: Trade In Animal Fur Products Act
345.description: Prohibits the sale, offer of sale, trade or distribution of fur products as defined and would make violations punishable by a civil fine.

346.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
346.title: General Election Day
346.description: Adds general election days to the list of holidays, in order to allow registered voters to cast their votes.

347.title: Justices Of The Peace -- Uniform Law On Notarial Acts
347.description: Codifies in the general laws the standards of conduct for notaries public in the state of Rhode Island by the secretary of state which came into effect on April 3, 2020. Takes effect on July 1, 2021; sunsets and expires on July 1, 2023.

348.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
348.title: Land Surveyors
348.description: Grants a right of entry for professional land surveyors to enter upon or cross any lands, air space or water resources necessary to perform surveying services except public utility and/or wastewater treatment facilities upon prior notice.

349.title: Claims Adjusters
349.description: Authorizes the department of insurance, within the DBR, in lieu of passing in-state licensing examination, to recognize the competence of an applicant for an insurance claims adjuster license, through an out-of-state proctored examination.

350.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
350.title: Collection Of Tax Sales --water Supply -- Water And Sewer Charges
350.description: Prevents the forced sale of real estate owned by persons who owe fire, water, sewer, road or lighting district charges.

351.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
351.title: Licenses Generally
351.description: Creates a Class B-W license to allow for the sale of beer and wine in grocery stores, convenience stores and markets throughout the state.

352.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
352.title: Motor Vehicle Reparations Act - Insurance Rates
352.description: Prevents the consideration of an applicant's credit history in determining automobile insurance rates.

353.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
353.title: Regulation Of Business Practices Among Motor Vehicle Manufacturers, Distributors, And Dealers
353.description: Prevents a motor vehicle dealer from leasing a new or used motor vehicle to a member of the public requiring the payment of the exact amount of any excise tax assessed on the new or used motor vehicle as reimbursement to the motor vehicle dealer.

355.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
355.title: All-electric Building Act
355.description: Provides that no city or town would issue a permit for the construction of new buildings that are not an all-electric building, if the initial application for a permit was submitted after December 31, 2023, unless certain circumstances apply.

356.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
356.title: General Regulatory Provisions -- Filing Of Assumed Name
356.description: Makes amendments necessary to use the term "trade name" rather than "assumed name", for purposes of the commercial law chapter on filing an assumed name/provides for the administration/regulation of the use of trade names with a 2 yr. renewal requirement.

357.title: Cemeteries
357.description: Prohibits perpetual care fund deposits use as to personnel of cemetery owners/restricts use to care of burial site/monuments/requires detailed annual report effective 1/1/2023.

359.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
359.title: Beverage Container Deposit Recycling Act Of 2022
359.description: Creates a refundable ten cent ($0.10) deposit for non-reusable beverage containers. A four cent ($0.04) handling fee would be paid by distributors.

364.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
364.title: Rhode Island Turnpike And Bridge Authority
364.description: Mandates the RITBA to design a safety barrier or netting system on the Mount Hope Bridge, the Claiborne Pell Bridge, and the Jamestown Verrazzano Bridge by April 1, 2022, with construction commencing no later than January 1, 2023.

365.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
365.title: Sidewalks
365.description: Requires that maintenance of sidewalks along state highways be the responsibility of the state. Such maintenance shall not include snow removal, sweeping and cleaning.

366.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
366.title: Employment Security Fund -- General Provisions
366.description: Appropriates federal American Rescue Plan Act funds to the state employment security fund in an amount sufficient to restore the fund to its level immediately prior to the governor's March 9, 2020, emergency declaration.

368.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
368.title: Catastrophic Illness In Children Relief Fund
368.description: Establishes Children's Catastrophic Illness in Children Relief Fund to provide finance assistance to families for medical expenses not covered by state or federal programs or insurance contract.

369.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
369.title: Core State Behavioral Health Crisis Services Systems
369.description: Establishes a core state behavioral health crisis services system, to be administered by the director of behavioral healthcare, developmental disabilities and hospitals.

370.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
370.title: Office Of Health And Human Services -- Minimum Wage For Providers
370.description: Requires state contracted human services providers to pay their employees a starting hourly wage, of no less than twenty-one dollars ($21.00) per hour, and to include wage incremental raises for existing employees.

371.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
371.title: Sales And Use Taxes - Liability And Computation
371.description: Exempts from taxation the retail sale of cloth or disposable face masks and facial coverings.

372.title: Restroom Access Act
372.description: Requires retail establishments with 3 or more employees on the premises without accessible public restroom to allow customers suffering from eligible conditions access to their employee restrooms.

373.last_action: Referred to Senate Health and Human Services
373.title: Treatment For Patients With Terminal Illness -- The Neil Fachon Terminally Ill Patients' Right To Try Act Of 2022
373.description: Creates the "Neil Fachon Terminally Ill Patients' Right To Try Act of 2022," which establishes the conditions for the use of experimental treatments for terminally ill patients.

374.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
374.title: Board Of Medical Licensure And Discipline
374.description: Prohibits the board of medical licensure and discipline from requiring specialty board certification as a condition of licensure.

375.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
375.title: Health Care Accessibility And Quality Assurance Act
375.description: Redefines the term "covered services" as used to describe applicable subscriber agreements between a health care entity and a dentist.

377.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
377.title: Home Care Recovery And Stability Act
377.description: Creates a moratorium until at least July 1, 2027 on the issuance of new licenses for home care providers, home nursing care providers and hospice providers.

378.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
378.title: Registration Of Nursing Assistants
378.description: Establishes category of licensed and trained home care nursing assistants to work exclusively in home care to address shortage in labor market for daily living services/home supports.

379.last_action: Referred to Senate Health and Human Services
379.title: Food Allergy Awareness In Food Service Establishments
379.description: Requires food service establishments to add an additional warning to their menus relative to food allergens and impose a penalty upon those establishments for failure to include the warnings on its menus. Failure to comply shall result in fines.

380.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
380.title: General Regulatory Provisions -- Rhode Island Data Transparency And Privacy Protection Act
380.description: Creates the "Rhode Island data Transparency and Privacy Protection Act" to identify information collected by online service providers and commercial websites.

381.title: General Regulatory Provisions -- Deceptive Trade Practices
381.description: Prohibits a digital application distribution platform that has cumulative sales annually in excess of ($10,000,000) from requiring a developer of a software application to engage in an exclusive distribution agreement with the distribution platform.

382.title: Solemnization Of Marriages
382.description: Requires returns of a marriage certificate to be filed within two (2) business days after the ceremony, and validates the common practice of filing the return by mail.

383.title: Automobile Accident Social Protection Act
383.description: Creates an accident compensation fund to provide payments and benefits to those injured by uninsured motorists, to be administered by the department of human services.

384.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
384.title: Public Safety Organization Personnel And Peer Support Members
384.description: Establishes a testimonial privilege for communications with critical incident stress management peer support personnel.

389.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
389.title: Procedure Generally -- Cause Of Action
389.description: Removes the statute of limitations for actions based on sexual abuse or exploitation of a child and would make eligible previously time barred actions.

390.title: Procedure Generally -- Evidence
390.description: Prohibits use of illegally seized evidence in administrative hearing involving fish/wildlife violations, limits penalties for violations to $500, establishes forfeiture provisions, requires hearing officers to decide constitutional issues.

391.title: Correctional Institutions -- Loss Of Rights By Prisoners
391.description: Repeals the provision of the general laws declaring prisoners serving a life sentence civilly dead.

392.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
392.title: Traveling Circuses Prohibited
392.description: Makes it unlawful to conduct, sponsor, walk, exhibit, or operate a traveling show or circus with that live wild or exotic animals in the State of Rhode Island. Violations would be punished by a fine of up to $500 and up to 30 days in jail.

393.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
393.title: Hazardous Waste Management
393.description: Prohibits the use of hazardous waste or solid waste as fill on any construction site project and renders the use of such soil as fill a felony.

394.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
394.title: Third-party Litigation Financing Consumer Protection Act
394.description: Comprehensively regulates the practices of third-party litigation financers in Rhode Island to provide transparency in litigation.

395.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
395.title: Special License For Motorcycles, Motor Scooters And Other Motor-driven Cycles
395.description: Requires any operator of a motorcycle, motor scooter or motor-driven cycle to wear a helmet. Violations would be punished by a fine of $100 and would increase the fines for failure of a passenger to wear a helmet to $100.

396.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
396.title: Department Of State -- Award Of Municipal Contracts
396.description: Requires the secretary of state to establish a registry for publication of municipal invitations for bids and would require that municipalities publish notice of invitations for bids with the registry.

398.title: Applicability Of Traffic Regulations
398.description: Allows the city council of the city of Warwick to enact ordinances authorizing the Warwick police department to impounded off-road non-registered vehicles that are unlawfully used on public streets.

399.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
399.title: Long-term Economic Development
399.description: Establishes a statewide greenhouse gas emission reduction mandate.

401.title: Canvassing The Lists Of Qualified Electors
401.description: Allows audio recordings to be taken at the local boards of canvassers’ proceedings and be maintained as a permanent record of the board.

402.title: Elective Meetings
402.description: Allows local board of canvasser's discretion to substitute the physical posting in each voting district of senatorial district meetings, representative district meetings, and voting district meetings with publication in newspaper of local circulation.

404.title: Video Lottery Games, Table Games And Sports Wagering

408.title: Voting Districts And Officials -- Polling Place Cap
408.description: Increases the maximum number of voters that a polling place can accommodate from three thousand (3,000) to three thousand five hundred (3,500)

409.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
409.title: Personal Delivery Devices
409.description: Defines mobile carrying device as any device that transports cargo within twenty-five feet (25') of the operator and is equipped with technology that permits the operator to control the device remotely.

410.title: General Regulatory Provisions -- Credit Card Lending
410.description: Modernizes the Rhode Island credit card lending statute by amending the definition of "credit card plan" to keep up with new technology and online purchasing and expressly allows merchants to continue to assist consumers with digital payment options.

412.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
412.title: Comprehensive Pfas Ban Act Of 2022
412.description: Prohibits use of PFAS in carpets, upholstered furniture, textile furnishings, apparel, cosmetics, juvenile products, cookware, firefighting foam and gives authority to the department of environmental management to regulate and the use.

413.description: Prohibits the sale or promotional distribution of any food package containing perfluoroalkyl and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS), effective January 1, 2024. Provisions of § 23-18.13-3(g)(3) sunset on July 1, 2027.

414.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
414.title: Field Trials And Shooting Preserves -- Captive Hunting Prohibited
414.description: Prohibits captive hunting for domestic or wild animals and does not prohibit the release of upland game birds for hunting on licensed shooting preserves.

416.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
416.title: Education Assistance And Development Tax Credit
416.description: Creates a tax credit for the amount in excess of ten thousand dollars ($10,000) contributed to a public school district for the express purpose of making physical improvements to a school.

417.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
417.title: Health Care For Children And Pregnant Women--equality In Abortion Coverage
417.description: Provide for abortion coverage in the Medicaid program and repeals the abortion coverage exclusion for state employee insurance plans.

419.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
419.title: Temporary Disability Insurance -- General Provisions
419.description: Increases the taxable wage upon which employees make contributions to the TDI and TCI funds and increases the maximum weeks for temporary caregivers from 4 to 12 weeks.

421.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
421.title: Medical Assistance -- Long-term Care Service And Finance Reform
421.description: Provides Medicaid home care base rate adjustments.

422.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
422.title: Relating To Taxation
422.description: Provides tax credits to any entity that relocates any part of the United States supply chain that currently is located in another country to Rhode Island.

424.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
424.title: National Guard
424.description: Raises the amount of life insurance the state would provide at no charge to Rhode Island National Guard members called up for federal duty to five hundred thousand dollars ($500,000).

425.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
425.title: Airports And Landing Fields
425.description: Increases the amount of reimbursement funds required to be paid by the Rhode Island airport corporation to the city of Warwick for municipal services from five hundred thousand dollars ($500,000) to one million four hundred thousand dollars ($1,400,000).

426.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
426.title: Inspection Of Dams And Reservoirs -- Environmental Study Of Johnson's Pond
426.description: Provides a dedicated grant of funding to DEM, specifically to commission an environmental study for the public benefit.

428.title: Individual Health Insurance Coverage
428.description: Establishes a special enrollment provision for pregnant women to obtain health insurance coverage at any time after the commencement of the pregnancy.

429.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
429.title: Conservation And Preservation Restrictions On Real Property
429.description: Requires conservation and preservation restrictions to be liberally interpreted in favor of the grants awarded.

432.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
432.title: Maintenance Of Order On Campus
432.description: Mandates arming campus police at public higher educational institutions and includes campus police in the definition of "law enforcement officer" for the purposes of the "Law Enforcement Officers' Bill of Rights."

433.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
433.title: Procedure Generally - Evidence
433.description: Provides that certain statements by a health care provider to a patient or the patient’s family would be inadmissible as evidence or an admission of liability.

435.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
435.title: Mechanical Trades
435.description: Authorizes issuance of P.J.F. limited HVAC service person's license upon examination for work on or repair of electric wiring/equipment located on heating/AC systems.

436.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
436.title: Rhode Island Parental And Family Medical Leave Act
436.description: Grants unpaid pregnancy leave to all part-time workers, would clarify their access to unpaid sick leave during their pregnancy, and would provide additional protections for pregnant workers who work in the medical field.

437.title: Unlawful Employment Practices
437.description: Prohibits an employer from inquiring about a prospective employee wage and salary history before an offer of employment with compensation has been negotiated.

439.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
439.title: Residential Landlord And Tenant Act
439.description: Limits residential rent increases to ten percent (10%) annually.

440.title: Sewage Charges -- Town Of Coventry
440.description: Authorizes the town of Coventry to provide for the payment of sewer assessments in installments up to a thirty year period.

441.title: Black Regiment Monument Commission
441.description: Establishes the Black Regiment Monument Commission to maintain the Black Regiment Monument located in Patriots Park in Portsmouth and its surrounding grounds/promotes the commemoration of the Black Regiment.

442.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
442.title: The Edward O. Hawkins And Thomas C. Slater Medical Marijuana Act
442.description: Includes domestic pets as eligible to use medical marijuana if certified by a licensed veterinarian.

443.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
443.title: Recognition Of Native American Tribes
443.description: Recognizes the Seaconke Wampanoag tribe as a Native American Indian tribe.

445.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
445.title: Primary Elections--general Assembly Offices--ranked Choice Voting
445.description: Establishes an instant runoff form of ranked choice voting limited to general assembly primary elections, with three (3) or more candidates.

450.title: Inspection Of Motor Vehicles
450.description: Exempt vehicles purchased at the end of their lease term by the current lessee that have a valid certificate of inspection affixed to the windshield from the requirement that dealers of used vehicles conduct a new inspection.

452.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
452.title: Arianna's Speech Fluency Act
452.description: Provides that the general assembly would appropriate $50,000 annually for a three (3) year pilot program on teacher training in the Orton-Gillingham classroom educator program.

454.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
454.title: Identification Of State Pension Funds With Military Contractors
454.description: Requires the state investment commission to identify pension fund investments in military weapon manufacturers whether held directly and indirectly.

458.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
458.title: Rhode Island School For Children With Dyslexia, Dyscalculia, And Dysgraphia
458.description: SEE TITLE 16 CHAPTER 97 -- THE RHODE ISLAND BOARD OF EDUCATION ACT

461.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
461.title: Medical And Clinical Services Programs Rate Review And Rate Setting Process Act Of 2022
461.description: Provides for rate setting and review for all medical programs licensed or having a contract with the state as well as Medicaid.

463.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
463.title: State Lottery
463.description: Designates a special account for veterans’ causes to be funded by Keno sales, less prizes and commissions, generated on Memorial Day and Veterans Day with disbursement pursuant to legislation and appropriation by the general assembly.

464.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
464.title: General Powers
464.description: Authorizes municipalities to tax school tuition and school meals. Contains exemptions from taxation.

467.title: Motor Vehicle Reparations Act
467.description: Amends the fine imposed for a first offense for failure to maintain financial security, to a maximum of one hundred twenty-five dollars ($125).

468.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
468.title: Economic And Climate Resilience Act Of 2022
468.description: Establishes a fee on companies that sell fossil fuels in Rhode Island.

469.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
469.title: Retirement System Contributions And Benefits
469.description: Awards all members of the pension system a three percent (3%) (COLA) if certain conditions are met.

470.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
470.title: Retirement System -- Membership And Service Credits
470.description: Exempts active members of the retirement system employed as a state public safety professional and/or a municipal police officer, from the cost to purchase retirement credit for their military service and interest charges.

471.title: Authorizing The City Of Providence To Finance A Contribution Towards The Unfunded Pension Liability Of The Employee Retirement System Of The City Of Providence By The Issuance Of Bonds In A Principal Amount Not To Exceed $515,000,000
471.description: Authorizes the city of Providence to finance a contribution towards the unfunded pension liability of the employee retirement system of the city of Providence by the issuance of bonds in the principal amount of $515,000,000 therefor.

473.title: The Psychology Interjurisdictional Compact
473.description: Authorizes the governor to enter into the Psychology Interjurisdictional Compact and designates an office to administer this compact.

474.last_action: Referred to Senate Health and Human Services
474.title: Assisted Living Residence Licensing Act
474.description: Requires department of health to establish an informal dispute resolution to address any changes to department of health violations.

475.title: Relating To Insurance
475.description: Requires coverage for treatment of pediatric autoimmune neuropsychiatric disorders associated with streptococcal infections and pediatric acute onset neuropsychiatric syndrome, including, but not limited to, the use of intravenous immunoglobin therapy.

476.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
476.title: By Possession And Prescription
476.description: Extends the time period to establish adverse possession of property from (10) years to (20) years for any lands, tenements or hereditaments excepting woodlands or uncultivated tracts, and thirty (30) years for woodlands and uncultivated tracts.

477.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
477.title: State Affairs And Government--prohibition On The Use Of Police Robot Technology
477.description: Prohibits on-duty/off-duty law enforcement officer from utilizing any robot/police robot dog/UAV, whether armed/unarmed, within the scope of their employment as well as police departments from purchase/procurement of any robots/UVAs/police robot dogs.

478.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
478.title: Passing, Use Of Lanes, And Rules Of The Road
478.description: Permits the practice of lane splitting by motorcycles.

479.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
479.title: Automated License Plate Readers
479.description: Provides for municipal and state police authorities to utilize automated license plate readers. Further, it identifies what data may be collected and defines how the data can be used.

480.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
480.title: Assaults
480.description: Makes an assault on taxi drivers a felony punishable by up to three (3) years imprisonment and an assault with a dangerous weapon punishable by five (5) to twenty (20) years imprisonment.

481.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
481.title: Consumer Credit History Employment Protection Act -- Deceptive Trade Practices
481.description: Prohibits employers from seeking/using credit reports in making hiring decisions concerning prospective employees, asking questions about the applicant's financial past during interviews or including credit history questions in their job applications.

482.title: Tip Protection
482.description: Prohibits employers from receiving any portion of the tips given by customers to their tipped employees, with limited exceptions for credit card service charges.

484.title: General Powers--portsmouth Municipal Court
484.description: Repeals the current authorization for town of Portsmouth municipal court and establishes authorization which expands the jurisdiction of Portsmouth municipal court to include a municipal housing court to adjudicate violations of the state building code.

487.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
487.title: Registration Of Voters
487.description: Increases the role of the division of motor vehicles in the voter registration and address verification process, by establishing very specific obligations and responsibilities.

488.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
488.title: Administrative Procedures -- Rules
488.description: Requires that all agencies final rules, promulgated pursuant to the administrative procedures act, be approved by general assembly action, but in no case later than December 31st of the year it is promulgated before it can become effective.

489.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
489.title: Retirement System -- Administration -- Board Composition
489.description: Adds active firefighters and police officers or officers from their respective union to the retirement board.

490.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
490.title: Condominium Law
490.description: Declaration or bylaws requiring approval would be approved if not recorded in 60 days.

493.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
493.title: Certificates Of Title And Security Interests
493.description: Enables Rhode Island licensed new motor vehicle dealers to conduct vehicle identification number inspections.

497.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
497.title: Net Metering- Renewable Energy Growth
497.description: Provides that certain eligible net metering systems projects, including solar siting, cannot be sited in Conservation Opportunity Areas.

500.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
500.title: Licensed Activities -- Lenders And Loan Brokers -- Check Cashing
500.description: Repeals the provisions of the general laws allowing deferred deposit providers, also known as "payday lenders."

501.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
501.title: General Regulatory Provisions Agricultural Equipment Right To Repair Act
501.description: Provides that original equipment manufacturers of agricultural equipment would provide independent service providers repair information and tools to maintain and repair electronics of the agricultural equipment.

502.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
502.title: Office Of The Special Education Ombud
502.description: Establishes the office of the special education ombud, independent of the RI dept of ed to ensure school districts throughout the state meet the minimum standards required to comply with individualized education programs for students with disabilities.

503.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
503.title: Council On Elementary And Secondary Education
503.description: Requires the council on elementary and secondary education to adopt standards which take into consideration the time and cost of transporting students across municipal boundaries and promotes maximum efficiency in other programs.

504.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
504.title: Rights And Duties Of Teachers Generally
504.description: Broadens the definition of "teacher" and create a comprehensive bill of rights for school teachers.

506.title: Aquaculture-emergency Closure
506.description: Allows the director of the department of environmental management to issue an emergency order requiring the temporary or permanent suspension of aquaculture activities in an affected area.

507.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (04/11/2022)
507.title: Pfas Chemicals
507.description: Prohibits the use of firefighting foam containing PFAS chemicals during training exercises and would prohibit firefighter turnout gear containing PFAS chemicals.

508.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
508.title: Refuse Disposal - Food Waste Ban
508.description: Amends § 23-18.9-17 to increase the miles of distance to thirty (30) a covered entity can be to an authorized composting facility or anaerobic digestion facility beginning January 1, 2023.

509.title: Zero-emission Lawn Care Devices
509.description: Mandates that all lawn care devices have zero-emissions by 2027, and a plan for such would be submitted to the house and senate by 2023.

510.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
510.title: Birds
510.description: Allows the taking of any wild bird by using a crossbow in addition to the weapons spelled out in this section.

511.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
511.title: Sanitation In Food Establishments -- Single Use Plastic Straws
511.description: Exempts drive-through and take-out establishments from providing a plastic straw only upon request by the consumer.

512.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
512.title: The Educational Equity And Property Tax Relief Act
512.description: Provides for an appropriation by the general assembly in the amount of two million dollars ($2,000,000) to the various school districts and municipalities to employ additional social workers.

514.title: Residence Of Children For School Purposes
514.description: Requires the department of education and the DCYF to develop a procedure to ensure that the municipalities where group homes or other residential facilities are located are reimbursed for the educational expenses above the cost allocated.

515.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
515.title: Rhode Island Veterans' Home
515.description: Allows cold war, veteran administration connected disability, and RI national guard with less than 90 days service admission into veterans home.

516.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
516.title: Department Of Human Services
516.description: Requires DHS to disburse $18,700,000 in $1,500 amounts total, $250 per month for 6 months as retention bonuses to direct care staff at childcare centers/licensed family providers.

517.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
517.title: Temporary Disability Insurance - Benefits
517.description: Increases the weekly dependency allowance for recipients of temporary disability insurance and temporary caregiver benefits from ten dollars ($10.00) to twenty dollars ($20.00).

518.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
518.title: Transportation Investment And Debt Protection Act Of 2011
518.description: Authorizes the Rhode Island public transit authority's coordinating council to develop a pilot program to address the needs of disabled individuals whose disability prevents independent use of a fixed route system.

523.title: Licensing Of Health Care Facilities
523.description: Requires operators of nursing homes to provide the department of health with detailed information on ownership and any person having an interest in the land, building or operation of the facility.

526.title: Student Computer Device Privacy
526.description: Prohibits an educational institution or school district from accessing or using location data for tracking a student's institutional device or personal device, except in limited circumstances.

527.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
527.title: General Regulatory Provisions -­ Deceptive Trade Practices
527.description: Prohibits certain providers of digital application distribution platforms from requiring that payments for the software application be made exclusively through a particular in-application payment system.

528.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
528.title: Identity Theft Protection Act Of 2015
528.description: Expands responsibilities of agencies, persons or entities that store, own, collect, process, maintain, acquire, use, or licenses data, who experiences a security breach, include providing additional information to persons affected and law enforcement.

530.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
530.title: Computer Crime
530.description: Allows for a civil action against parents of a student who demonstrate willful or wanton disregard for the duty to supervise their child who has committed the offense of cyberstalking or cyberharassment.

531.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
531.title: Accidents And Accident Reports -- The Matthew O'gara Act Of 2022
531.description: Increases the penalties for a first offense of leaving the scene of an accident resulting in death to a minimum five (5) years in incarceration, a minimum of ten thousand dollars ($10,000) and a minimum license revocation of five (5) years.

534.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
534.title: House Committee Of The Repealer
534.description: Creates the house committee of the repealer to compile suggestions for repeal of statutes, regulations, and executive orders received from citizens, businesses, and government agencies.

536.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
536.title: Contested Pet Ownership
536.description: Creates a legal process by which formerly cohabitating parties could seek from the district court a determination as to ownership of any pet.

539.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
539.title: Subdivision Of Land
539.description: Amends the definition of minor land development and minor subdivision and changes the time limits for other land developments and major subdivision certificates.

540.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
540.title: Ordinances
540.description: Requires that all cities and towns file all ordinances and amendments to those ordinances with the secretary of state. Such ordinances or amendments to those ordinances would become effective upon filing with the secretary of state.

544.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
544.title: Construction And Maintenance Of State Roads
544.description: Requires the department of transportation to establish a schedule of all landscaping and mowing of lawns on state roads, and provide a copy of said schedule to the department of public works in any city or town where the state road is located.

545.title: Operators' And Chauffeurs' Licenses
545.description: Creates a pilot program for the thirty-three (33) hour driver education program to be offered in an online and virtual format, effective October 1, 2022 and would sunset on October 1, 2024.

546.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
546.title: Redistricting Act
546.description: Creates a redistricting commission to act every ten (10) years to adopt a redistricting plan for all general assembly and congressional districts that would require the approval of the general assembly and the governor.

547.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
547.title: Party Committees And Conventions
547.description: Seeks to eliminate all state requirements and involvement in internal political party operations and workings.

548.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
548.title: Departments Of State Government
548.description: Requires that the secretary of EOHHS, the secretary of commerce of the commerce corporation and the commissioners of elementary and secondary education and postsecondary education be appointed subject to the approval of the senate.

549.title: Accident And Sickness Insurance Policies -- Biomarker Testing Coverage
549.description: Requires health insurers, nonprofit hospital service corporations, nonprofit medical service corporations and health maintenance organizations that issue policies that provide coverage for biomarker testing on or after 1/1/23.

550.title: The Rhode Island Cannabis Act
550.description: The Rhode Island Cannabis Act legalizes adult use of cannabis. It provides for licensing of cultivation, manufacture and retail sale of cannabis.

551.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
551.title: Transportation Of Beverages - Out-of-state Direct Wine Shipment License
551.description: Creates an out-of-state direct wine shipment license along with numerous regulatory provisions.

552.title: Kratom Consumer Protection Act
552.description: Regulates the distribution of food products containing the drug kratom, a drug of concern for its stimulant and sedative effects, to consumers by the department of health.

553.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
553.title: Child Support Intercept Act
553.description: Expands child support interception of insurance payments to include life insurance proceeds payable to non-custodial parents who are beneficiaries of the policy.

554.title: Contractors' Registration And Licensing Board
554.description: Revises the manner in which complaints against contractors are made, processed, investigated, and resolved in a more efficient and expeditious manner and makes various technical and grammatical corrections.

555.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
555.title: Powers And Operations
555.description: Prohibits financial institutions from investing in private detention centers or continuing to invest with any institution, company or subsidiary of a company that owns or contracts with a government entity to manage or run a prison.

556.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
556.title: Telephone Sales Solicitation Act
556.description: Authorizes the attorney general to institute proceedings to enforce any order of restitution pursuant to this chapter.

559.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
559.title: Business Notification Act
559.description: Requires businesses to be notified of any regulatory changes which materially impact the business.

560.title: Uniform Limited Partnership Act
560.description: Enacts the Rhode Island Limited Partnership Act to govern the law of limited partnerships in this state and repeal chapter 12 of title 7 entitled "Limited Partnerships".

561.title: Relocation Of Utility Services
561.description: Amends the formula used to reimburse a utility facility or company for the cost of relocation necessitated by highway construction.

562.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
562.title: Hoisting Engineers
562.description: Provides that public engineers and individuals utilizing equipment and performing volunteer services on land trust, conservation, or the individuals' personal property be exempt from the provisions of law relating to licensing of hoisting engineers.

564.title: Biliteracy Seal
564.description: Allows high school students receiving state Silver/Gold Seal of Biliteracy to earn 2 to 4 semesters of college credit toward minor/major in language at public university/community college if requested within 3 yrs. after high school graduation.

565.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
565.title: Chiara's Law -- Screening And Education Of Children With Dyslexia
565.description: Requires screening for dyslexia and related disorders for public school students in grades kindergarten through grade four (K-4) and would provide for instruction in cursive writing.

567.title: Licensing
567.description: Prohibits the departmental of environmental management or any other licensing authority issuing hunting or fishing licenses, from requiring any applicant to provide their social security number or other tax identification number.

568.title: 2021 Act On Climate
568.description: Establishes the Rhode Island executive climate change coordinating council equity and environmental justice advisory board to advise on decision-making and equitable outcomes.

569.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
569.title: Nonwoven Disposable Products Act
569.description: Provides needed relief to waste water utilities and their rate payors by establishing a consistent standard for the flushability of wipes and requires accurate labeling regarding the flushability of the product.

570.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
570.title: Citizens Commission For The Safety And Care Of The Elderly
570.description: Amends several sections of law relating to safety and care for the elderly including amending the composition of the commission and requiring designated representatives within the police and fire departments to serve as older adults safety advocates.

571.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
571.title: The Rhode Island Urban Education Act Of 1998
571.description: Establishes the urban student mentorship program to reduce chronic absenteeism and promote better academic outcomes for student in urban communities.

573.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
573.title: Department Of Healthy Aging
573.description: Renames the Office of Healthy Aging to The Department of Healthy Aging, restructures the administration and delivery of services, and expands the authority of its director in various ways.

574.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
574.title: Rhode Island Commerce Corporation -- Rhode Island Black Economic And Community Development Fund
574.description: Establishes the Rhode Island Black economic and community development fund as an investment fund to address issues of discrimination and exploitation of the Black community.

575.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
575.title: District Court
575.description: Creates within the district court a dedicated calendar offering treatment and sentencing alternatives to eligible defendants deemed to suffer from serious and persistent mental illness.

578.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
578.title: Home Heating Greenhouse Gas Emissions Reduction Act
578.description: Creates the Home Heating Greenhouse Gas Emissions Reduction Act which program provides a mechanism and funding for gas companies to transition from providing gas heat to non-emitting renewable thermal energy for home heating consumers.

579.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
579.title: The Green Justice Zone Act
579.description: Creates the "green justice zone act" and the "environmental justice act" and makes amendments to several other areas of the general laws designed to create a system to provide clean water and air to the state.

580.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
580.title: Management And Disposal Of Property
580.description: Promotes the use of state surplus property by permitting the department of administration to obtain an appraisal and sell property to be used for housing development purposes where appropriate.

581.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
581.title: Central Falls Business Cooperative Incubator
581.description: Appropriates $100,000 annually to Fuerza Laboral for the purposes of the development and management of a business cooperative located in Central Falls to increase economic development, assists with job creation and a path to business ownership.

582.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
582.title: City Of Pawtucket Downtown Redevelopment Project
582.description: Provides that portions of the city of Central Falls would be included within the Pawtucket Downtown Redevelopment Project.

584.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
584.title: Relating To Behavioral Healthcare, Developmental Disabilities And Hospitals
584.description: Establishes a community mental health services revolving fund, to help fund the construction and renovation of facilities to provide mental health services.

585.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
585.title: Maternal And Child Health Services For Children With Special Health Care Needs
585.description: Directs the executive office of health and human services to increase Medicaid rates for the Early Intervention and First Connections programs allowing for payment of competitive wages for qualified professionals.

586.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
586.title: Insurance Benefits
586.description: Entitles correctional officers with twenty-five (25) years of service and who are at least fifty-five (55) years of age to a non-Medicare-eligible retiree health care insurance benefit.

589.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
589.title: Veterans' Affairs
589.description: Provides that every city and town must maintain a municipal veterans' service officer. Would also authorize a $100,000 appropriation to be used for support and outreach for veterans.

590.title: Personal Care Attendant Program For Minors
590.description: Creates a personal care attendant program for minors with disabilities to provide personal care to those individuals and allow family members, inclusive of the minors’ parent, to serve as the individual’s personal care attendant and be compensated.

591.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
591.title: Funding Of Charter Public Schools
591.description: Requires charter schools that disenroll or return a student to the original sending school prior to the end of an academic year, to return all public funds received by the charter school to educate that student for that academic year.

592.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
592.title: Rhode Island Promise Scholarship
592.description: Provides that a student who enrolls for the first semester at CCRI after the student completes basic training prior to becoming a military reservist is eligible for a promise scholarship.

593.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
593.title: Rhode Island Hope Scholarship Act
593.description: Establishes the Rhode Island hope scholarship act to provide up to the cost of two (2) years of tuition costs and mandatory fees for eligible students in hopes to increase the numbers for enrollment and graduation.

594.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
594.title: Adult Education
594.description: Modernizes expand access and provide additional funds to adult education programs in the state, create a strategic plan for adult education establish learning, intake and assessment centers.

595.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
595.title: Increasing Opportunities For Teachers Of Color Act
595.description: Promotes the development, utilization and opportunities for teachers of color. It would provide for a two million dollar annual appropriation for a scholarship fund for teacher employment in urban schools.

596.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
596.title: Offenses Against Registration And Certificate Of Title Laws
596.description: Decreases the amount of the reinstatement fees for a motor vehicle registration or certificate of title which was revoked, denied or suspended and reduced reinstatement fees for suspension or revocation of registration or certificate of title.

597.title: Rhode Island Housing Resources Act Of 1998
597.description: Amends membership of the RI Housing Resources Act of 1998 Commission to exclude a representative of the insurers and replace it with a representative of a Rhode Island city or town with a population below 25,000 with a median family income of 40,000.

598.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
598.title: The Rhode Island Works Program
598.description: Allows families to continue to receive state and federal tax credits and any stimulus funds provided for the well-being of children or adults without jeopardizing the family's RI Works cash benefit.

599.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
599.title: Agreement To Phase Out Corporate Incentives Compact Act
599.description: Establishes a compact agreement among at least two (2) states to prohibit the use of subsidies to selectively retain industry or company entice relocation from one state to another state or to open a new facility.

600.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
600.title: Independent Military Organizations
600.description: Eliminates the $2,500 appropriation for the naval militia battalion in their armory afloat, the U.S.S. Providence, and makes an annual appropriation in the amount of $2,500 to the Kingston Reds in the town of Coventry for the rental of an armory.

601.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
601.title: Retirement System -- Contributions And Benefits
601.description: Effective July 1, 2022, entitles environmental police officers to the benefits provided by chapter 45-21.2 entitled "Optional retirement for members of police force and firefighters."

602.title: Retirement Of Municipal Employees - Reemployment Of Police Officers
602.description: Exempts retired police officers from the seventy-five (75) day rule which restricts employment for retirement purposes, when they work private details for a nongovernmental entity.

604.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
604.title: Personal Income Tax - Military Retirement
604.description: Excludes for the purposes of Rhode Island state income taxes, the first $25,000 of eligible military retirement income, paid by the state or federal government to persons 60 years or older received in the 2023 tax year, and thereafter.

605.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
605.title: Teachers' Retirement - Post-retirement Employment
605.description: Temporarily removes the cap on the number of days that retired teachers and administrators can work, without penalty, from July 1, 2022 to July 1, 2024 when the provisions of this act would sunset.

606.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
606.title: Deferred Compensation Plans
606.description: Allows participating municipalities to elect to its employees the deferred compensation plans offered by the state.

607.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
607.title: Veterans' Affairs -- Veterans' Home In House Occupational Therapy
607.description: Requires the general assembly to appropriate necessary funds for the furnishing of in-house occupational and physical therapy services for all residents of the Bristol Veterans' home.

610.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
610.title: Electric Transportation Act
610.description: Provides for a plan and structure to transition to green energy in motor and other vehicles.

613.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
613.title: Sales And Use Taxes -- Liability Computation
613.description: Exempts from sales and use taxes: burial containers, urns, urn liners, urn vaults, grave liners, grave vaults, burial liners, burial vaults, burial tent setups, and prayer cards.

615.title: Estate And Transfer Taxes -- Liability And Computation
615.description: Phases in an annual increase of the net taxable estate exemption over an eight (8) year period until the state exemption equals the federal exemption.

619.title: Vital Records
619.description: Adds the division of taxation, division of motor vehicles and department of revenue to those agencies who receive lists of reported deaths.

620.title: Uniform Controlled Substances Act
620.description: Authorizes licensed veterinarians to control and prescribe chorionic gonadotropin strictly for veterinary use and when that use is approved by the Food and Drug Administration.

623.title: Mental Health Law
623.description: Includes licensed advanced practice registered nurses (APRN), certified in psychiatric/mental health, as qualified to certify the need for mental health treatment in certain patients.

627.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
627.title: Licensing Of Healthcare Facilities
627.description: Mandates a patient shall not be denied appropriate care on the basis of age/sex/gender identity/sexual orientation, race/color/marital status/familial status/disability/religion/national origin/source of income/source of payment or profession.

628.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
628.title: Licensing And Monitoring Of Child Placing Agencies, Child Caring Agencies, Foster And Adoptive Homes, And Children's Behavioral Health Programs
628.description: Requires all persons granted a foster care license to undertake ongoing training to promote their sensitivity to their foster child's culture.

630.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
630.title: Organized Retail Crime Act Of 2022
630.description: Establishes organized retail crime act which criminalizes the concerted action of 3 or more people that engage in organized theft from retail stores. Punishable by up to 5 years imprisonment with forfeiture provisions.

631.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
631.title: Payments Of Wages
631.description: Increases the criminal penalties for wage theft and employee misclassification.

633.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
633.title: Bed Bugs In Residential Premises Act
633.description: Spells out the responsibilities of both the landlord and tenant with respect to the inspection and treatment of bed bugs in residential premises.

634.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
634.title: Residential Landlord And Tenant Act--immigration Status
634.description: Prohibits a landlord from inquiring about the immigration status of a tenant subject to any federal laws or regulations, but may request financial information or proof of identity.

636.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (03/17/2022)
636.title: Residential Landlord And Tenant Act--rent Stabilization Act
636.description: Limits rent increases to no more than four percent (4%) annually.

637.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
637.title: Residential Landlord And Tenant Act -- Security Deposits
637.description: Allows a residential tenant, if they wish, to pay their security deposit in twelve (12) equal installment payments at the same time they pay their monthly rent.

638.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
638.title: Procedure Generally -- Equity Practice
638.description: Deletes all uses of the word master as it relates to courts and replace it with the word arbiter.

639.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
639.title: Courts -- Judicial Selection
639.description: Promotes more diversity in the composition of the judicial nominating commission and would require that each list of qualified judicial candidates it submits to the governor for nomination include two (2) people of color.

640.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
640.title: Judicial Selection
640.description: Requires the judicial nominating commission to include certain questions on application/retain race, nationality, ethnicity, and gender data/classifies application as public record with opt out provision.

641.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
641.title: Relating To Courts And Civil Procedure--courts--court Administration--selection Pool For Court Appointed Receivers
641.description: Requires that the selection pool for court appointed receivers be composed of at least fifteen percent (15%) of receivers who are persons of color and that at least fifteen percent (15%) of all court appointed receivers be persons of color.

642.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
642.title: County Grand Juries
642.description: Permits grand juries to issue reports and provides for a process for review and acceptance by the superior court for dissemination to the public.

644.title: Proceedings In Aid Of Execution
644.description: Requires that upon issuance of a citation, the judgment debtor is given twenty-five (25) days to contact the judgment creditor to resolve the matter prior to court intervention.

647.title: Indictments, Informations And Complaints
647.description: Includes the offense of second-degree sexual assault among the offenses to which there shall be no statute of limitations.

648.title: Theft, Embezzlement, False Pretenses, And Misappropriation
648.description: Corrects the erroneous misdemeanor classification of the criminal offense of fraudulent conversion by agent or factor.

649.title: Probation And Parole Support Act
649.description: Modifies current procedures for the application and collection of court costs, fees and assessments in all criminal matters.

650.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
650.title: Burglary And Breaking And Entering--injury Or Death-defense
650.description: Creates a rebuttable presumption as a matter of law in any civil or criminal proceeding that the owner, tenant, or occupier of any place where a violent crime has occurred from a duty to retreat.

652.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
652.title: Protection And Supervision Of Criminal Witnesses
652.description: Amends the name of the title of chapter 12-30 of the general laws to be "The Jennifer Rivera Witness Protection Act".

654.title: Interception Of Wire And Oral Communications
654.description: Adds felony violations of Uniform Act on Prevention of and Remedies for Human Trafficking as a designated offense for an application for an order under the Interception of Wire and Oral Communications statute.

655.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
655.title: Interception Of Wire And Oral Communications -- Where Applications May Be Made
655.description: Allows the presiding justice of the superior court to designate an associate justice of the superior court to accept application for wire taps.

656.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
656.title: Burglary And Breaking And Entering
656.description: Creates a mandatory jail sentence of ten (10) years for two or more people who break into a business with the intent to steal.

658.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
658.title: Commercial Sexual Activity
658.description: Grants immunity to any person engaged in or witnessing commercial sexual activity if they report the offense to law enforcement and in good faith assist or attempt to assist in the investigation of offense, even if they later withdraw their cooperation.

660.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
660.title: The Civil Rights Act Of 1990 -- The Crown Act
660.description: Defines the terms "race and ethnicity" to include ancestry, color, ethnic group identification, and ethnic background and inclusive of traits historically associated with race, including, but not limited to, hair texture and protective hairstyles.

662.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
662.title: Operators' License -- Safe Roads And Mandatory Insurance
662.description: Requires an applicant for a license to provide a valid social security number. This act creates an alternative ID driving license for applicants without a social security number who are able to establish proof of Rhode Island residency.

664.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
664.title: Adoption Of Children
664.description: Permits a petition for adoption, and if necessary, termination of parental rights, to be filed by a grandparent(s) without the noncustodial parent(s') consent, when the child is in the sole custody of the grandparent(s).

665.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
665.title: Comprehensive Community-police Relationship Act Of 2015
665.description: Proposes revisions to the Comprehensive Community-Police Relationship Act of 2015.

666.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
666.title: Relating To Statutes And Statutory Construction
666.description: Replaces the terms "mentally retarded"/"retarded" as used in the general laws with the words "intellectual and/or developmental disability" or "person with an intellectual and/or developmental disability." Implements § 43-3-7.1.

667.title: Dna Detection Of Sexual And Violent Offenders
667.description: Removes diversion programs from the list of criminal convictions subject to mandatory DNA collection.

668.title: False Representation Of Military Status
668.description: Creates the crime of stolen valor, for falsely representing himself or herself as a member of the military or armed forces, which is punishable by imprisonment of not more than one year, a fine of one thousand dollars ($1,000), or both.

672.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
672.title: Workers' Compensation - Occupational Diseases
672.description: Classifies as an occupational disease any disability or quarantine resulting from COVID-19 or other viral infection, classified by an executive order, during a declared state of emergency, subject to certain requirements.

673.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
673.title: Minority Business Enterprise
673.description: Increases the dollar amount of public works projects that shall be awarded to minority business entities to a minimum of twenty-five percent (25%) of the dollar value of the project.

675.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
675.title: Payment Of Wages - Employee Records
675.description: Requires employer to furnish items and conditions of employment and a pay stub explaining how wages were calculated/reasons for deductions/allows the employee to file a court action against employer for violation.

676.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
676.title: Rhode Island Fair Housing Practices Act
676.description: Prohibits a seller's agent from receiving buyer "love letters" when receiving offers to purchase real property.

677.title: Rhode Island Housing Resources Act Of 1998 -- New Shoreham Affordable Housing Eligibility
677.description: Increases the percentage of area median income from one hundred twenty percent (120%) to one hundred forty percent (140%) only for New Shoreham residents to make more households eligible for affordable housing.

678.title: Tourism Improvement Districts
678.description: Enables municipalities to create tourism improvement districts to increase economic activity in the tourism industry.

683.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
683.title: Child Advocate Office
683.description: Requires those appointing committee members to the advisory committee of the child advocate's office to use diversity as a criteria in making the appointments and requires committee meet twice annually and report to General Assembly yearly.

684.title: Justices Of The Peace--standards Of Conduct For Notaries Public
684.description: Allows the continuance of the remote notarization following the expiration of the executive emergency order currently in effect and requires a certificate of any notarial act.

686.title: Registration Of Outboard Motors
686.description: Prohibits the DEM and any city or town from requiring an owner of any watercraft from providing their social security number or other tax identification number in order to register or obtain a certificate of title for such watercraft.

689.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
689.title: Race, Ethnicity, Gender And Disability Impact Statement Act
689.description: Requires the general assembly to provide race, ethnicity and gender impact statements as to all legislation, addressing the disproportionate impact of the legislation on people of color and gender.

690.title: Department Of Administration
690.description: Requires the office of diversity, equity and opportunity (ODEO) to create, and for all state and municipal employees to receive, annual training in cultural competency. Defines "cultural competency".

692.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
692.title: Municipal Detention Facility Corporations
692.description: Prohibits the operation of private detention facilities and private public partnerships within the state and prohibits the housing of Rhode Island prisoners in other states as well as hold out-of-state prisoners in Rhode Island facilities.

693.title: Relating To State Affairs And Government-- Corrections Department
693.description: Directs the department of corrections to collect information from individuals entering its custody: sex, race, nativity (country of origin), religion, and level of education.

694.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
694.title: Residence Of Individuals In Government Custody Act
694.description: Requires that the state use the actual residences of persons in government custody for redistricting purposes. Such information would be collected by the department of corrections and forwarded to the secretary of state, to be utilized for redistricting.

697.title: University Of Rhode Island
697.description: Provides that the URI Board of Trustees meeting requirement for a quorum is ten (10) voting members. The act further provides that a seventeen (17) member board be appointed by the governor with the advice and consent of the senate.

698.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
698.title: Historical Society Libraries
698.description: Requires the general assembly appropriate funds to the state librarian for the purpose of caring for, preserving and cataloguing property in the state in the keeping of the Rhode Island Black Heritage Society.

699.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
699.title: Historian Laureate Of Rhode Island
699.description: Reduces the appoint the historian laureate from a five (5) year term to a three (3) year term, and requires the historian laureate to develop and implement programs about pertinent aspects of Rhode Island history.

702.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
702.title: State Building Code -- Administration And Enforcement
