702.description: Eliminates provisions establishing a legislative regulation committee, and also repeals the provision that codes and standards adopted by the state building code standards committee would be subject to approval by the legislative regulation committee.

704.title: General Regulatory Provisions -- Purchase And Sale Of Precious Metals -- Catalytic Converters
704.description: Requires a purchaser of a catalytic converter to obtain a copy of the registration for the vehicle from which the catalytic converter was removed with exceptions.

705.title: Surplus Lines Insurance
705.description: Updates and clarifies various insurance statutes.

706.title: Uniform Partnership Act
706.description: Enacts the Uniform Partnership Act to govern the law of partnerships in this state.

707.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
707.title: Historic Preservation Tax Credits 2013
707.description: Extends the expiration of the Historic Preservation Tax Credits program from June 30, 2022 to June 30, 2023.

708.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
708.title: Relating To State Affairs And Government- Governor's Clean Energy Workforce Transition Commission
708.description: Creates the Governor’s Clean Energy Workforce Transition Commission.

712.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
712.title: Emergency Medical Transportation Services
712.description: Requires any person who transports a patient by a stretcher in a vehicle to be licensed as an emergency medical services provider through the director of health.

713.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
713.title: Restrictive Housing At Correctional Facilities Act
713.description: Establishes conditions/policies/procedures for inmates' restrictive housing with guidelines/restrictions for disciplinary/ transitional disciplinary/step-down housing with annual report on DOC website.

714.title: Rhode Island Title Insurers Act
714.description: Provides only licensed attorney can be title insurance agents and determine insurability/marketability. Prohibits discounted insurance premiums and fee sharing with unlicensed agents and attorneys.

715.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
715.title: Deer Hunting
715.description: Permits any person with a concealed carry permit to carry and possess their pistol or revolver while deer hunting, provided that, the pistol or revolver is not used for deer hunting.

719.last_action: Referred to Senate Special Legislation and Veterans Affairs
719.title: Registration Of Vehicles--license Plates
719.description: Changes the location of "State of Rhode Island" and "ocean state" on the registration plates.

722.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
722.title: Rhode Island Business Corporation Act
722.description: Makes numerous technical amendments to the statutes on taxes and corporations, associations and partnerships.

723.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
723.title: Excavation Near Underground Utility Facilities
723.description: Requires any public utility or its contractor to reimburse an excavator for lost time expense incurred, including manpower and equipment from the utility's incorrect marking of underground utilities.

724.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
724.title: Water Supply
724.description: Provides that water utility companies be responsible for all costs associated with maintenance, operation and delivery of water pumping stations to individual parcels of land and schools with no pumping stations on the property.

725.title: Insurance Data Security Act
725.description: Adopts the National Association of Insurance Commissioners Model Act regarding data security to establish standards for data security and standards for the investigation of and notification to the commissioner of a cybersecurity event.

726.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
726.title: Long-term Care Insurance
726.description: Updates the long-term care insurance statute so that it is in conformance with the latest version of the National Association of Insurance Commissioners model.

727.title: Rhode Island Life And Health Guaranty Association Act
727.description: Brings the Rhode Island Life and Health Guaranty Fund statute into conformance with the latest version of the National Association of Insurance Commissioners Model Act.

729.title: Creation And Expansion
729.description: Amends a number of provisions in the general laws relative to financial institutions by eliminating unnecessary requirements and/or clarifying language in order to reduce certain burdens on businesses operating in Rhode Island.

730.title: Water Resources Management
730.description: Provides the standards for reviewing applications for plans or work for the extension of supply or distribution mains or pipes. It also adds an appeal of a denial by a public water supply facility pursuant to the administrative procedures act § 42-35-15.

732.title: Animal Diseases In General
732.description: Authorizes the director of the department of environmental management to establish quarantine zones for animals and would permit the examination of any quarantined animal therein.

734.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
734.title: The Clean Atmosphere Act
734.description: Establishes regulations to reduce hazardous emissions by prohibiting manipulation of the environment, and collects application and violation fees into state trust fund for municipality projects that promote the safety of life and property.

735.title: Mercury Reduction And Education Act
735.description: Prohibits, beginning January 1, 2024, any compact fluorescent lamp or linear fluorescent lamp to be offered for final sale, sold at final sale, or distributed in the state as a new manufactured product.

737.title: State Lottery - Lottery Sales Agent Renewal Period
737.description: Extends the renewal period for lottery sales agent's license from one year to two (2) years.

738.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
738.title: Intellectual/developmental Disabilities Ombudsperson Act Of 2022
738.description: Creates an intellectual/developmental disabilities ombudsperson program.

739.title: Department Of Health -- Rhode Island Tobacco Control Program
739.description: Establishes a tobacco control program to fund tobacco control initiatives and implement evidence-based programs that align with the federal Centers for Disease Control and best practices.

740.title: Alzheimer's Disease And Related Disorders Ombudsperson Act Of 2022
740.description: Establishes Alzheimer's disease/related disorders ombudsperson program in DOH to advocate for/assist individuals in coordinating medical/social services care.

741.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
741.title: Temporary Disability Insurance -- Contributions
741.description: Decreases an employee's obligation for contribution from wages and requires an employer to contribute one-half of the amount to an employee's contribution.

743.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
743.title: Relief Of Injured And Deceased Firefighters And Police Officers
743.description: Extends IOD benefits to police officers/firefighters suffering from post-traumatic stress injuries/provides municipal police/firefighters retiring due to PTSI accidental disability retirement allowance.

744.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
744.title: State Funds - Restricted Receipt Accounts
744.description: Adds the Workers' Compensation Administration, the Rhode Island Uninsured Employers' Fund and the Rhode Island Uninsured Protection Fund, to the restricted receipt accounts not subject to indirect cost recoveries.

745.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
745.title: Motion Picture Production Tax Credits
745.description: Increases the motion picture production company tax credit to ten million dollars ($10,000,000) and cap the available total of credits to forty million dollars ($40,000,000). This act would also eliminate the sunset provision.

750.title: Program Of All-inclusive Care For The Elderly
750.description: Ensures that all hospitals and hospital-owned professional practices accept payment for all-inclusive elderly care which is no more than one hundred (100%) of what Medicare would pay for the same services.

751.last_action: Referred to Senate Health and Human Services
751.title: Nurses
751.description: Amends the conditions upon which a nurse would be exempt from certain licensing requirements to include eligibility to practice before taking and receiving results of the NCLEX exam.

752.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
752.title: Sale Of Tobacco Products In Pharmacies
752.description: Prohibits the sale of tobacco products in pharmacies and would provide for a civil penalty of two thousand dollars ($2,000) for each violation.

753.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
753.title: Weapons -- Education -- Health And Safety Of Pupils
753.description: Establishes school security committee administer increased school security measures and an active shooter training program to increase school security and permit exemptions for entering school property by anyone with a carry concealed carry permit.

759.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
759.title: Minority Business Enterprise -- Minority Business Enterprise Participation
759.description: Increases the amount of state contracts awarded to minority business enterprises to at least fifty percent (50%) of the total value of the entire dollar value of the contract.

764.title: Open Meetings -- Remote Participants
764.description: Allows University of Rhode Island trustee members to remotely participate in meetings, without excuse, and to have them considered as the meeting quorum.

765.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
765.title: Code Of Ethics
765.description: Requires a public official or employee to disclose any and all unsatisfied default judgments of credit card debt, in excess of one thousand dollars ($1,000) on their financial statement.

766.title: State Archives
766.description: Clearly defines permanent state records to be retained/ requires preparation of disaster preparedness plan/ allows access to superior court for injunctions/ restraining orders for violations of public records laws.

769.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
769.title: General Provisions - Manufacturing And Wholesale Licenses
769.description: Authorizes the issuance of farmer-brewery and farmer-distillery licenses to qualifying farms subject to conditions and regulations issued by the department of business regulation.

770.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
770.title: Business Fast-start Office
770.description: Requires the fast-start office to regularly convene business owners in the state to gather recommendations to improve business licensing procedures.

773.title: Employee Criminal Records Check
773.description: Requires any organization licensed by the department of BHDDH with 250 or more employees to have background checks conducted by the attorney general's office and require checks every 5th year of continuous employment.

774.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
774.title: Emergency Management - Limitations
774.description: Allows any city or town to add the municipality as a third-party beneficiary where the original contract causes a violation of a municipal ordinance, in the amount of three percent (3%) of the total compensation of the contract.

781.title: Size, Weight, And Load Limits
781.description: Transfers all responsibility for oversize/overweight permitting to the department of transportation and amends and increases fines for all oversize and overweight infractions.

782.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
782.title: Electronic Vehicle Recovery Service Act
782.description: Requires vehicle owners with electronic vehicle recovery systems to submit affidavit attesting to theft prior to law enforcement contact with provider for aid in locating vehicle.

783.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
783.title: Regulation Of Sales
783.description: Permits the DMV, in its discretion, to issue digital driver’s license(s) and identification card(s) to be stored on a person's portable electronic device and to be viewed or verified by a person to whom access is allowed.

785.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
785.title: Relating To Public Utilities And Carriers
785.description: Provides the Public Utilities Commission would establish a prevailing wage rate for all covered renewable energy system projects involving public works and renewable energy resources.

786.title: Regulation Of Electric Bicycles
786.description: Regulates electric bicycles in the same manner as human-powered bicycles, classify electric bicycles into three (3) classes, require all electric bicycles to have a label affixed to the bicycle and be equipped with a speedometer.

787.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
787.title: Non-emergency Medical Transportation
787.description: Establishes a safe and reasonable regulatory framework for companies and drivers providing non-emergency medical transportation services to a population of vulnerable passengers through coordination with the state's health and human service agencies.

788.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
788.title: Taxicabs And Limited Public Motor Vehicles
788.description: Requires national and state background checks for certain drivers transporting passengers for hire.

789.title: Insurance Consumer Protection Sales Act
789.description: Prohibits person/business entity from conditioning requiring offer for sale/lease of tangible personal property on purchase of insurance. From any insurance producer/insurer or releasing consumer's personal identification info effective 1/1/23.

790.title: Prompt Payment By Department Of Administration
790.description: Amends the provisions for prompt payment of monies owed by the department of administration to their contractors or subcontractors.

792.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
792.title: Department Of Business Regulation--automobile Wrecking And Salvage Yards
792.description: Prohibits any entity/individual from advertising sale/purchase/receipt/transport/salvage of junks/discarded vehicle unless done by licensed auto wrecking/salvage yard subject to civil fines.

793.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
793.title: The Rhode Island Cesspool Act Of 2007
793.description: Allows DEM to extend certain deadlines for required sewer construction in the replacement of cesspools, which deadlines would not extend beyond January 1, 2027.

794.title: Pupil Transportation Vehicles
794.description: Amends the definitions of a "Pupil Transportation Vehicle" to be and constructed to seat not more than ten (10) passengers including the operator, rather than the existing limit of eight (8) passengers.

796.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
796.title: Relating To Motor And Other Vehicles
796.description: Establishes emission standards for diesel engines and registration of diesel fuel dealers.

798.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
798.title: Greenhouse Gas Pollution Standard
798.description: Establishes the greenhouse gas pollution standards project to ensure the state achieves the emission reduction goals of the act on climate as those projects pertain to transportation alternatives and projects.

800.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
800.title: Damages From Milldams -- The Johnson's Pond Protection Act
800.description: Makes the Mill Damn Act subject to the provisions of the Freshwater Wetlands Act.

801.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
801.title: Proper Management Of Unused Paint
801.description: Requires DEM to request proposals every 2 years to solicit representative organization to operate paint stewardship program.

804.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
804.title: Medical Professional Scholarship Program
804.description: Establishes medical professional scholarship program within postsecondary education council with commission awarding $5,000 for 4 years of college attendance to eligible applicants funded by $25 assessment fee on medical professionals seeking licensure.

805.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
805.title: Community Mental Health Services
805.description: Establishes Certified Community Behavioral Health Clinics.

809.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
809.title: Background Checks Of Volunteers And Interns
809.description: Waives fees for the applicant to volunteer at a school. It also waives fees for criminal background checks on any employee seeking employment for a position with a salary of less than forty thousand dollars ($40,000).

810.title: Employment Security--general Provisions
810.description: Extends until June 30, 2023, an increase in the total amount of earnings a partial-unemployment insurance claimant can receive before being entirely disqualified for unemployment insurance benefits.

811.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
811.title: Department Of Revenue
811.description: Removes the collection unit sunset provision of June 30, 2023.

812.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
812.title: Personal Income Tax -- Capital Gains
812.description: Amends the capital gains tax rates and holding period from 5 years to 1 year. Imposes a non-owner occupied tax on homes assessed at more than $1,000,000. Increases estate tax exemption to $2,225,000.

813.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
813.title: Estate And Transfer Taxes--liability And Computation
813.description: Eliminates the estate tax in Rhode Island.

816.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
816.title: Department Of Health
816.description: Prohibits the sale or offer for sale of any flavored electronic nicotine-delivery system.

819.title: Mental Health Counselors And Marriage And Family Therapists
819.description: Creates entry-level licensing program to allow applicants as a mental health counselor assoc. or marriage/family therapist assoc. to practice under supervision prior to becoming licensed a mental health counselor or licensed marriage/family therapist.

823.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
823.title: Wholesale Prescription Drug Importation Program
823.description: Establishes the Wholesale Prescription Drug Importation Program for the importation of wholesale prescription drugs from Canada to provide savings to Rhode Island consumers.

824.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
824.title: Prescription Drug Cost Protection
824.description: Prohibits the state, ERISA or any health plans to purchase referenced drugs for a cost higher than the referenced rate.

825.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
825.title: Prescription Drug Benefits
825.description: Caps the total amount that a covered person is required to pay for a covered prescription asthma inhaler to fifty dollars ($50.00) per thirty (30) day supply.

826.title: Home And Community Care Services To The Elderly
826.description: Amends the composition of the home and community care advisory committee.

828.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
828.title: Department Of Health -- Tobacco Product Sales' Restrictions
828.description: Prohibits the sale of certain flavored tobacco products and electronic nicotine-delivery systems with exemptions for compassion centers and licensed cultivations registered with the department of business regulation.

831.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
831.title: Unfair Sales Practices
831.description: Prohibits consumer generated Internet data cannot be sold for profit by a social media platform without the consent and compensation to consumer.

834.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
834.title: Disorderly Conduct
834.description: Requires conduct that creates an actual public disturbance that includes a gathering of people drawn to and watching the conduct, stopping, impeding or causing traffic, or creating similar public disturbances in order to constitute disorderly conduct.

841.title: Procedure In Particular Actions -- Rhode Island Commercial Receivership Act
841.description: Creates temporary non-liquidating receivership program for businesses with substantial revenue decline after declared emergency/suspended/ceased substantial part of operation resulting by emergency police/regulatory powers.

844.last_action: Referred to Senate Health and Human Services
844.title: Office Of Health Care Advocate
844.description: Permits the health care advocate to receive confidential health care information with individual patient information but would prohibit the disclosure of the information, except pursuant to judicial process.

845.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
845.title: Operation Of Bicycles--highway Safety Act
845.description: Amend several chapters regarding the operation of bikes on state highways and interaction with motor vehicles, aggressive honking, reckless driver accountability program & speed limits in thickly settled areas/business districts.

846.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
846.title: Solemnization Of Marriages--common Law Marriage
846.description: Abolishes common law marriages entered into in this state on or after January 1, 2023, while recognizing the validity of any common law marriage entered into or adjudicated to exist before January 1, 2023.

847.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
847.title: Payment Of Wages
847.description: Eliminates repealed statute references and create a mechanism for employees to enforce their existing right to continuation of medical benefits.

848.title: Labor Relations Act
848.description: Removes the ban that prohibited members of the state labor relations board from holding public office.

849.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
849.title: Fair Employment Practices
849.description: Prohibits an employer, employment agency, labor organization, or employee, to commit any act declared to be an unlawful employment practice; individuals would be held personally liable for such conduct.

850.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
850.title: Fair Employments Practices
850.description: Amends the definition of employees to include individuals under appointment/contract/apprenticeship/volunteer or unpaid intern covered by fair employment practices.

853.title: Permanent Joint Committee On Naming All New Buildings, Bridges, Edifices And Other State Constructions
853.description: Provides that the corner of 496 Main Street and Joyce Street along state route 114 in the town of Warren, Rhode Island, would be known as Delekta’s Corner.

856.title: Hotels
856.description: Provides reasons for an innkeeper to remove guests from a hotel, and permits an innkeeper to refuse admission to a person under eighteen (18) years of age.

857.title: Solicitation By Charitable Organizations
857.description: Exempts not-for-profit food banks from the registration requirements under the "solicitation by charitable organizations" statute.

859.title: The Paul W. Crowley Rhode Island Student Investment Initiative See Title 16 Chapter 97 -- The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act
859.description: Requires that every middle school under the control of the council on elementary and secondary education for failure to meet improvement or performance goals, shall employ a cultural coordinator to be paid for by the state.

861.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
861.title: The Rhode Island Quality Enhancement In Afterschool And Out-of-school Time Act
861.description: Provides funding for afterschool, summer learning and workforce development programs for students in grades K-12.

862.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
862.title: State Aid To Libraries
862.description: Requires that the state’s share to public libraries be fixed at twenty-five percent (25%) of the amount appropriated by the city or town in their budgets for fiscal year 2023, utilizing funds from the general fund or the American Rescue Plan Act.

863.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
863.title: Rhode Island Information Privacy Act
863.description: Allows an individual to access and learn what personal information about the individual has been gathered and stored by covered entities that conduct business in Rhode Island.

864.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
864.title: Municipal Roads And Bridges Maintenance And Construction Financial Assistance
864.description: Establishes a new fund, with 50% of state motor vehicle registration fees, to be administered by the director of the department of transportation, for municipal road and bridges' maintenance and construction projects.

866.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
866.title: State Business Technology Live, Work, And Play Parks
866.description: Establishes the state business technology live, work, and play parks program, to be administered by the commerce corporation.

867.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
867.title: Rhode Island Underground Storage Tank Financial Responsibility Act
867.description: Eliminates the Rhode Island Underground Storage Tank financial advisory board and include the cleanup of residential heating oil tanks under the eligibility for reimbursement from the cleanup fund.

869.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
869.title: Rhode Island Commerce Corporation -emergent Technology
869.description: Establishes a fund under the administration of the Rhode Island Commerce Corporation to establish grants to emergent technology developers with the focus being on technologies that assist in reducing emissions and achieving the goals of the Act on Climate

870.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
870.title: The First-time Homebuyers Savings Account Act
870.description: Authorizes the creation of first-time homebuyer savings account from which savings to purchase a home could be deducted from an individual's or couple's personal income taxes.

873.title: Public Records Administration
873.description: Updates public records administration act, modifies records control schedule, designates records officer, establishes procedures for retention of records. Provides administrator submit yearly reports, establishes public reporting compliance.

875.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
875.title: Refunding Bond Authority
875.description: Changes the designations of "state budget office" to the "office of management and budget".

877.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
877.title: Procedure Generally -- Litigation Lending Agreements
877.description: Makes litigation loan agreements subject to state usury laws.

878.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
878.title: Procedure In Particular Actions - Death By Wrongful Act
878.description: Raises minimum wrongful death recovery to $365,000 adjusted annually for inflation.

879.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
879.title: Workers' Compensation -- Procedure
879.description: For purposes of liability of third persons for damages relating to claims for workers compensation, provides that reimbursement not be provided for certain damages, and reduces any award by any percentage of the employees comparative negligence.

882.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
882.title: Body-worn Camera Regulation Act
882.description: Police body cameras required. Restricts use of force. Mandates various police reporting.

883.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
883.title: Law Enforcement Integrity Act
883.description: Specifies and restricts use of excessive physical force by peace officers and creates a civil action for constitutional rights violations as well as impose a duty to intervene on officers on scene. Requires reporting of incident information.

885.title: Executive Office Of Commerce
885.description: Provides that the deputy secretary of commerce and housing become the secretary of housing and retains all the powers and duties of the deputy secretary of commerce and housing.

886.title: Low And Moderate Income Housing
886.description: Permits multi-family rental apartment units to be built as part of a comprehensive plan and to be included in the calculation of low or moderate income housing.

896.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
896.title: Regional Juvenile Hearing Board
896.description: Amends the public law creating the Johnston/Smithfield Regional Juvenile Hearing board to allow a board member to serve more than two terms if no other person seeks appointment to the board.

897.title: Abandonment By Towns
897.description: Allows the town of Cumberland upon request to sell the highway or driftway to the abutting owner at fair value.

898.title: Health And Educational Building Corporation
898.description: Provides municipalities in the state with appropriate additional means to improve the health, living conditions, and welfare of their residents with expanded access to public educational, or child daycare centers, or public recreational facilities.

904.title: Affordable Clean Energy Security Act
904.description: Amends the affordable clean energy security act and the long-term contracting standard for renewable energy.

905.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Roberts And Rocha, Inc.
905.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Roberts And Rocha, Inc.

906.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Graduate Student Association, Inc.
906.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Graduate Student Association, Inc.

907.title: The College And Career Success For All Students Act
907.description: Requires all high school seniors in the state to complete a federal financial aid application (FAFSA) or a Rhode Island Alternative Financial Aid Application, offered through the Community College of Rhode Island in order to graduate high school.

908.title: Office Of The State Fire Marshal
908.description: Provides certain parties may not enter onto property where a fire occurred for solicitation or inspection of a fire loss, without the permission of the owner or occupant, until the property is released to the owners or occupants.

909.title: Relating To Businesses And Professions
909.description: Decreases the number of OSHA training hours from three (3) hours to one hour.

910.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
910.title: Motor Fuel Tax
910.description: Imposes a moratorium on the payment of the fuel tax until June 30, 2023.

911.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
911.title: Sales And Use Taxes--liability And Computation--beer And Malt Beverage Exemption
911.description: Exempts beer and malt beverage from sales tax.

912.title: Rebuild Rhode Island Tax Credit
912.description: Requires that all entities receiving tax credits from the state pay their workers the prevailing wage or other payments pursuant to § 37-13. This act would also allow the revocation of the tax credits for violation of this act.

913.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
913.title: Authorizing And Allocating $8,000,000 To Women And Infants Hospital
913.description: Authorizes and allocates the sum of $8,000,000 to the Women and Infants Hospital of Rhode Island, to be used towards the Hospital's renovation of its Labor and Delivery Unit. The allocation comes from American Rescue Plfunds.

919.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
919.title: Office Of Health And Human Services
919.description: Establishes privacy and security protections for closed-loop referral systems.

921.title: Filing Of Assumed Name
921.description: Requires individuals transacting business in RI under any assumed name to file in person, by mail, or electronically with the office of the city or town clerk the true or real full name(s) of the person(s) transacting business and their email address.

922.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
922.title: Control Of High Prescription Costs -- Regulation Of Pharmacy Benefit Managers
922.description: Regulates PBMs policies and practices relating to accurate costs and pricing reporting, restricts discriminatory practices and establishes consumer protections and enforcement of penalties for violations by the office of the attorney general.

923.title: Rights Of Nursing Home Patients--staffing
923.description: Exempts certain nursing home facilities from the state minimum level staffing requirement under certain circumstances.

924.title: Division Of Developmental Disabilities
924.description: Creates a workload study for social caseworkers II in the division of developmental disabilities within BHDDH. The study would be completed within one year and the results reported to the general assembly.

925.title: Tourism And Development
925.description: Removes the requirement that five percent (5%) of the hotel tax be paid to the Greater Providence-Warwick Convention and Visitors Bureau and redistribute the five percent (5%) tax to the city or district where the hotel or residential unit is located.

930.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
930.title: Extreme Risk Protection Orders
930.description: Prohibits sheriffs from charging/accepting fees from any Rhode Island law enforcement agency for service of any temporary or 1-yr extreme risk protection order. Requires sheriffs to accept petitions/summons, by email, facsimile or other electronic means.

933.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
933.title: Labor Disputes
933.description: Adds a section to labor disputes that prevents the use of police as harassment in a labor dispute.

934.title: Address Confidentiality Program
934.description: Creates an Address Confidentiality Program for persons subjected to domestic violence.

935.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
935.title: Workers' Cooperatives
935.description: Clarifies the role of a workers' cooperative to allow it to operate as a hiring hall under certain circumstances.

936.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
936.title: 2022 Energy Storage Act
936.description: Requires the office of energy resources to initiate the process of developing one or more programs, and associated funding mechanisms, for electric energy storage resources connected to the electric distribution system.

938.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
938.title: Distributed Generation Interconnection
938.description: Modifies the application process for interconnection projects to require greater transparency/greater clarity through an 8 member committee and independent ombudsman with prospective application.

939.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
939.title: Failing School Choice Act
939.description: Establishes the Failing School Choice Act, to permit students at failing schools to enroll in any public school. It also establishes the Rhode Island education revitalization fund to provide funding to the school choice program.

940.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
940.title: Language Academies Act
940.description: Establishes language academies for non-English proficient students and establishes the Rhode Island education revitalization fund to provide funding to the language academies.

941.title: Rhode Island Hard-hit Liquidity Program Act
941.description: Establishes the “Rhode Island Hard-Hit Emergency Liquidity Program Act” to provide up to twenty million dollars ($20,000,000) to businesses adversely affected by the Coronavirus pandemic by providing aid for drop in sales.

942.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
942.title: Licensing Of Nursing Service Agencies
942.description: Establishes maximum rate for services provided to client by a nurse may not exceed 200%.

943.title: In Accordance With Rhode Island General Laws § 16-7-44 Approving The Issuance Of $5,000,000 General Obligation Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Of The Town Of East Greenwich To Finance The Renovation, Rehabilitation, Repair, Replacement, Improvement, Furnishing, Equipping And Installation Of School, School Facilities And Infrastructure, Including, But Not Limited To, Safety And Fire-code Related Improvements, Roofs, Heating, Ventilation, Electrical Systems, Landscaping, Grounds, Athletic Fields, Information Technology, Vehicles And Food Service Facilities
943.description: Serves as the enabling act required by Rhode Island general laws § 16-7-44 in order for the interest on bonds issued in support of school housing projects to be eligible for state housing aid reimbursement.

944.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
944.title: Sexual Assault Survivors Bill Of Rights
944.description: Creates sexual assault survivors bill of rights with right to counsel and assault counselor/rules for collection/delivery/testing/analysis/retention of forensic evidence/privacy/15 member task force with $250,000 for 4 years of annual funding.

945.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
945.title: Environmental Justice Act
945.description: Requires the department of environmental management to create environmental justice areas.

946.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
946.title: Public Use Of Private Lands-liability Limitations
946.description: Changes the definition of owner to exclude the state and municipalities for the purposes of liability limitations relating to public use of private lands.

949.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
949.title: Harbors And Harbor Lines
949.description: Allows the town of North Kingstown to regulate the activities of all houseboats in all public waters within the town's jurisdiction, including the enforcement and supervision of any ordinances, rules and regulations governing its public waters.

950.title: Block Island Utility District Act Of 2017
950.description: Provides that the members of the board of the Block Island Utility Commission be reimbursed for the actual and necessary expenses incurred in the performance of their duties.

951.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
951.title: Explosives
951.description: Requires two weeks' notice to all abutters within five hundred feet of the commencement of any blasting operations.

952.title: Interstate Medical Licensure Compact
952.description: Creates the Interstate Medical Licensure Compact allowing physicians to become licensed in multiple states and practice under the jurisdiction of the state in which the patient is located.

953.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
953.title: Rhode Island Secure Choice Retirement Savings Program Act
953.description: Establishes the Rhode Island secure choice retirement savings program, which provides for the creation of IRA-type retirement investments managed by a board established by the act which would be a public corporation.

954.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
954.title: Retirement System -- Contribution And Benefits
954.description: Increases the maximum post retirement employment earnings from eighteen thousand dollars to twenty-five thousand dollars a year for certain retired educators.

956.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
956.title: Harm Reduction Center Advisory Committee And Pilot Program
956.description: Extends the expiration date of the Harm Reduction Center Advisory Committee and Pilot Program by two years, from March 1, 2024, to March 1, 2026.

958.title: Coastal Resources Management Council
958.description: Provides a definition of the Recognizable High Tide Line for the Public's Rights and Privileges of the Shore.

959.title: Department Of Labor And Training--digital Credentialing
959.description: Mandates the department of labor and training to require publicly funded workforce and training programs to supplement all paper-based credentials with verified electronic credentials.

960.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
960.title: Rhode Island Housing Resources Act Of 1998 -- Affordable Housing
960.description: Imposes restrictions on residential developments. Changes affordability limits for household income for eligible renters and owners. Defines first generation homebuyer. Creates a restricted receipt account for fees generated by this section.

962.title: Education Accountability Act
962.description: Extends the due date for the district action plan each and every year from September 1 to December 1, and further require that there are no fewer than five (5) school district education reviews annually beginning in academic year 2025-2026.

963.title: Rights Of Nursing Home Patients
963.description: Due to the COVID-19 health crises, suspend the provisions of § 23-17.5-33, relating to nursing home staffing.

964.title: Snowmobiles And Recreational Vehicles
964.description: Creates misdemeanor penalties for any person driving or operating any recreational vehicle on any local highway unless specifically permitted by ordinance or exempted as a permitted crossing.

967.title: Labor Standards In Renewable Energy Projects
967.description: Established labor standards applicable to renewable energy projects and conditions/procedures for applicants related to labor agreements with enforcement by department of labor and training (DLT).

969.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
969.title: Health Care Workforce Stabilization Program
969.description: Provides for a fund to administer retention payments of two thousand five hundred dollars ($2,500) for certain health care workers who worked during the COVID-19 pandemic.

972.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Municipal Government & Housing
972.title: Controlled Substances Therapeutic Research Act
972.description: Requires local approval by the city or town council and a voter referendum for any place of sale or distribution center of recreational marijuana located within that municipality.

974.title: Levy And Assessment Of Local Taxes--east Providence Revaluation
974.description: Extends the current revaluation date in the city of East Providence from December 31, 2021 to December 31, 2022.

975.title: Levy And Assessment Of Local Taxes -- Warwick Revaluation
975.description: Delays the city of Warwick's second statistical update following the 2015 revaluation from 2021 to 2022 and would base the update on valuations as of December 31, 2022.

979.title: Refuse Disposal
979.description: Adds advanced recycling as a definition for refuse disposal. Adds the advanced recycling facility that means a facility that receives, stores and converts post-use polymers and recovered feedstocks using advanced recycling.

984.title: The Paul W. Crowley Rhode Island Student Investment Initiative
984.description: Revises the process and procedures for state intervention and support for failing public schools, including Providence, as well as chronically under-performing schools.

985.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
985.title: Cooperation With Federal Government
985.description: Authorizes members of an individual's family and legally responsible adults to receive payment for delivering home and community based services to developmentally disabled adults and children with special needs.

987.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
987.title: Retention Of X-rays
987.description: Amends the retention of x-ray statute by eliminating retention for the life of the individual to retention for whatever period is required by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services.

988.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
988.title: Licensing Of Youth Camps
988.description: Establishes the procedures and requirements for the licensing of youth camps.

989.title: Levy And Assessment Of Local Taxes -- Town Of Johnston Tax Classification
989.description: Amends the law pertaining to tax classifications in the town of Johnston to allow it to enact tax classifications in accordance with the nature of the real and personal property to be taxed.

990.title: Levy And Assessment Of Local Taxes--town Of Johnston Revaluation
990.description: Grants the town of Johnston a one year extension to complete the revaluation due in 2022. The revaluation would be based on valuations as of December 31, 2022.

994.last_action: Introduced, referred to House State Government & Elections
994.title: Authorizing The City Of Cranston To Establish, Adopt, And Reapportion The City Council And School Committee Voting Wards
994.description: Authorizes and ratifies the action of the Cranston city council which reapportioned and redistricted its six (6) voting wards based on the most recent federal decennial census.

995.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
995.title: Casualty Insurance Generally -- Liquid Fuel Coverage
995.description: Requires that casualty insurance provide coverage for property damage on the insured's property caused by or in response to a release of heating oil from a residential liquid fuel tank.

997.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
997.title: 2022 Bond Referenda
997.description: Submits 2022 capital development program requesting the issuance of $100,000,000 in general obligation bonds to the voters for approval at the November 8, 2022, general election.

999.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
999.title: National Security Infrastructure Support Fund
999.description: Requires the general assembly to provide grants and loans to improve, maintain and operate Burma Road in Middletown and Portsmouth which is owned by the United States government, along with an additional $50,000 for an economic impact study.

1004.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1004.title: Comprehensive Health Insurance Program
1004.description: Establishes a universal, comprehensive, affordable single-payer health care insurance program and helps control health care costs, which would be referred to as, "the Rhode Island Comprehensive Health Insurance Program" (RICHIP).

1006.title: Housing Maintenance And Occupancy Code
1006.description: Allows a municipality to impose a debt in favor of the corporate unit against the owner when the municipality relocates the occupant and authorizes the corporate unit to choose the vendors to assist qualifying homeowners with repair costs.

1007.title: General Powers -- Town Of Narragansett-- Landing Fee
1007.description: Increases the landing fee at the Port of Galilee in the town of Narragansett from thirty-five cents ($.35) to fifty cents ($.50).

1010.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1010.title: Permanent Joint Committee On Naming All New Buildings, Bridges, Edifices, And Other State Constructions
1010.description: Names the student academic counseling center located in the athletic complex sector of campus at Rhode Island college in Providence, the "Ann Cullen student-athlete success center."

1012.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1012.title: Office Of State Fire Marshal
1012.description: Creates task force to study the issue of PFAS in firefighter gear, to monitor development of alternatives to this gear, develop timeline for replacing gear statewide and to develop strategy for funding the replacement gear from state or federal funds.

1014.last_action: Referred to Senate Health and Human Services
1014.title: Rhode Island Physical Therapist Licensure Compact Act
1014.description: Establishes physical therapist licensure compact in order to facilitate interstate practice of physical therapy with the goal of improving public access to physical therapy services.

1019.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1019.title: Community College Of Rhode Island
1019.description: Names the Newport campus of the Community College of Rhode Island the M. Teresa Paiva Weed campus.

1020.title: Residential Solar Energy Disclosure And Homeowners Bill Of Rights Act
1020.description: Provides solar energy system consumers with consumer protection regarding disclosures cancellation and liens.

1022.title: Electricians
1022.description: Provides penalties for owners of structures who interfere with inspections by electrical investigators.

1025.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1025.title: Athletic Coaches
1025.description: Requires school committee/governing body of charter/private school to notify RIDE of athletic coaches/trainers terminated for cause with RIDE required to maintain/allow access to non-public record list by hiring authority for any school.

1026.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1026.title: The Green Housing Public-private Partnership Act
1026.description: Creates the green housing public-private partnership act to incentivize the construction of properties with climate emissions reduction goals.

1027.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1027.title: Lead Poisoning Prevention Act
1027.description: Establishes a lead water supply replacement program for public and private service lines within the next ten (10) years and requires the disclosure to tenants and buyers of real property of the presence of lead service lines.

1028.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1028.title: Musical And Theatrical Production Tax Credits

1035.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Sisters, Inc.
1035.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Sisters, Inc.

1036.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Rhode Island Real Estate Rehabilitation Corporation
1036.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Rhode Island Real Estate Rehabilitation Corporation

1040.title: Authorizing The Town Of Scituate To Issue General Obligation Bonds And Notes In An Amount Not To Exceed $750,000 To Finance Equipment, Repairs And/or Improvements At The Scituate Public Schools
1040.description: Town of Scituate to issue not more than $750,000 bonds and notes to finance various improvements at the town of Scituate’s schools and constitutes an enabling act of the general assembly that is required pursuant to § 16-7-44.

1041.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1041.title: In Amendment Of Chapter 492 Of The Public Laws Of 2006 Amending The Charter Of The Central Coventry Fire District
1041.description: Amends the Central Coventry Fire District Charter to provide for purchasing, installing, operating and maintaining street lighting and the funding for its debt. Provides for the appointment of an Assistant Treasurer.

1042.title: In Amendment Of Section 4 Of Chapter 1321 Of The Public Laws, 1915, Entitled "fixing The Time For The Election Of Officers In The Town Of Scituate" As Previously Amended By Chapter 3777 Of The Public Laws Of 1956 And Authorizing The Town Of Scituate To Change The Date Of Its Fiscal Year And Allowing The Tax Levy For A Transitional Fiscal Year To Exceed The Maximum Set Forth In Section 44-5-2.
1042.description: Changes the annual financial town meeting date for Town of Scituate to the first Tuesday in the month of June starting in the calendar year 2024.

1043.title: Levy And Assessment Of Local Taxes -- Town Of New Shoreham -- Revaluation
1043.description: Grants the town of New Shoreham a one-year extension to complete the revaluation due in 2022. The revaluation would be based on valuations as of December 31, 2022.

1045.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1045.title: Relating To Making Appropriations In Support Of Fy 2022
1045.description: Appropriates $1.0 million in state funds to nonprofit hospitals serving large governmentally insured populations with a primary care focused (internal medicine and/or family practice) program that started after January 1, 2021.

1047.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1047.title: Rhode Island Housing And Mortgage Finance Corporation
1047.description: Requires that the Rhode Island Housing and Mortgage Finance Corporation create, maintain and update a statewide directory of all municipal and private housing rental properties, that accept government subsidized housing vouchers.

1048.title: Self-service Storage Insurance
1048.description: Creates a legal framework for regulating self-service storage insurance in this state. It declares that the sale, solicitation or offer of self-service storage insurance, as defined, does not require an insurance producer license.

1049.title: Evidence And Oversight Act Of 2022
1049.description: Creates the Evidence and Oversight Act of 2022 to create and maintain a data transparency portal.

1050.title: Narragansett Indian Land Management Corporation
1050.description: Renames and repeals sections of the Narragansett Indian Land Corporation Act and acknowledges the Narragansett Indian Tribe as the sole aboriginal people sovereign to the territory of Rhode Island.

1051.title: Dignity At Work Act
1051.description: Establishes a broad and comprehensive framework to provide workers with more protection and remedies from bullying and harassment in the workplace.

1052.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Municipal Government & Housing
1052.title: Narragansett Tribal Sovereignty Act
1052.description: Provides that the Narragansett Indian tribe be considered a sovereign and federally recognized Indian tribe and exempt the tribe and its members and organizations from taxation.

1054.title: Dam Permits
1054.description: Requires dam owner/operator with storage capacity over 1,400 normal storage acre feet of water to obtain DEM permits to raise/lower water level. Not applicable to public water supply system dams.

1056.title: Judgments, Orders, And Decrees -- Interest In Civil Actions
1056.description: Provides that pre- and post-judgment interest on civil actions begin on the date of the filing of the civil action and be calculated based upon a rate equal to the coupon issue yield equivalent.

1058.title: Nonprofit Hospital Service Corporations--rate Review Act
1058.description: Creates uniform rate review procedure for rates to be changed.

1059.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1059.title: Certification Of Teachers
1059.description: Extends teacher certifications without fee or penalty for three (3) years for teachers who hold certifications as of July 1, 2022.

1060.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1060.title: Unfair Claims Settlement Practice Act
1060.description: Makes it an unfair claims practices act violation for an insurer to fail to have an appraisal performed by a licensed appraiser when a vehicle sustains damage in excess of $5,000. Also corrects a citation regarding salvage and reconstructed titles.

1061.title: Quality Self-directed Services
1061.description: Increases the hourly compensation for "individual providers" from no less than fifteen dollars ($15.00) on April 1, 2022, and gradually increase several times until June 30, 2023, when it would be eighteen dollars ($18.00) and continuing.

1062.title: Authorizing The Town Of Westerly To Issue Not To Exceed $50,000,000 General Obligation Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness To Finance The Construction, Renovation, Improvement, Alteration, Repair, Furnishing And Equipping Of Schools And School Facilities Throughout The Town, Subject To Approval Of State Housing Aid At A Reimbursement Rate Or State Share Ratio Of Not Less Than 35% For Expenditures Eligible For State Aid And Provided That The Authorization Shall Be Reduced By Any Grant Received From The School Building Authority Capital Fund
1062.description: Authorizes the Town of Westerly to issue bonds and notes in an amount not exceeding $50,000,000 to finance the construction, renovation, improvement, alteration, repair, furnishing and equipping of schools and school facilities throughout the town.

1063.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Health & Human Services
1063.title: Mandated Health Insurance Benefits Advisory Council
1063.description: Creates the mandated health insurance benefits advisory council, to analyze the state's current health insurance benefits mandates and to review retrospectively and prospectively the mandates.

1065.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Municipal Government & Housing
1065.title: Fair Chance In Housing Act
1065.description: Limits the use of certain criminal records and credit history reports in denying housing to prospective applicants, provides fines for failure to comply and requires notice of denials be sent to the prospective tenants.

1066.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Issue Not To Exceed $330,000,000 General Obligation Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness To Finance The Acquisition, Construction, Improvement, Furnishing And Equipping Of A New High School And School Facilities And All Expenses Incident Thereto, Including But Not Limited To, Costs Of Design, Demolition, Athletic Fields, Landscaping And Parking, Subject To Approval Of State Housing Aid At A Reimbursement Rate Or State Share Ratio Of Not Less Than 83.7% For Expenditures Eligible For State Aid And Provided That The Authorization Shall Be Reduced By Any Grant Received From The School Building Authority Capital Fund
1066.description: Authorizes the city of Pawtucket to issue not more than $330,000,000 general obligation bonds, notes and other evidences of indebtedness to finance the acquisition, construction, improvement, furnishing and equipping of a new high school.

1067.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Health & Human Services
1067.title: Counseling Compact
1067.description: Allows for the interstate practice of licensed professional counselors with the goal of improving public access to professional counseling services, by providing for the mutual recognition of other member state licenses through the counseling compact.

1069.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1069.title: Relating To The Kingston Fire District In The Town Of South Kingstown
1069.description: Clarifies that qualification to vote in elections of the Kingston Fire District extends to those residents of the District qualified to vote in the town of South Kingstown elections.

1070.last_action: Referred to Senate Housing and Municipal Government
1070.title: Relating To Incorporate The Foster Fire District
1070.description: Creates a Foster Fire District with authority to levy taxes, for the purpose of providing fire and rescue services to the town of Foster, subject to its approval by qualified electors within the town of Foster, at the November 8, 2022, general election.

1071.title: Authorizing The Town Of Narragansett To Finance The Improvement, Replacement, Construction, Renovation, Repair, Reconstruction And/or Restoration Of Roadways, Sidewalks, Storm Drains, Public Buildings And Other Public Infrastructure In The Town Of Narragansett And To Issue Not More Than $20,000,000 Bonds And Notes Therefor
1071.description: Authorizes the town of Narragansett to issue up to $20,000,000 general obligation bonds, notes and other indebtedness to finance the improvement, replacement, construction, and repair of roadways, sidewalks, drains, and buildings.

1072.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Provide For The Construction, Renovation And Improvement, Repair, Alteration, Furnishing And Equipping Of Public Buildings In The City And Authorizing The Financing Thereof, Including The Issue Of Not More Than $18,350,000 Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, To Fund The Capital Improvement Program For The Two Fiscal Years 2024 And 2025
1072.description: Authorizes the city of Pawtucket to issue not more than $18,350,000 general obligation bonds, notes and other evidences of indebtedness to finance the construction, renovation, improvement, repair, alteration, furnishing and equipping of public buildings.

1073.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Provide For The Repaving Of Streets In The City And All Costs Related Thereto And Authorizing The Financing Thereof, Including The Issue Of Not More Than $3,000,000 Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, To Fund The Capital Improvement Program For The Two Fiscal Years 2024 And 2025
1073.description: Authorizes the city of Pawtucket to issue not more than $3,000,000 general obligation bonds, notes and other evidences of indebtedness to finance the repaving of streets and all costs related thereto.

1074.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Provide For The Design, Construction, Reconstruction And Repair Of Streets, Sidewalks And Other Transportation Infrastructure Improvements Including, But Not Limited To, Drainage And Landscaping And Authorizing The Financing Thereof, Including The Issue Of Not More Than $1,200,000 Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, To Fund The Capital Improvement Program For The Two Fiscal Years 2024 And 2025
1074.description: Authorizes the city of Pawtucket to issue not more than $1,200,000 general obligation bonds, notes and other indebtedness to finance design, construction, reconstruction and repair of streets and sidewalks including, drainage and landscaping.

1075.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Provide For The Planning, Evaluation, Design, Construction, Equipping And Reconstruction Of The Sanitary Sewers And Storm Sewers In The City And Authorizing The Financing Thereof, Including The Issue Of Not More Than $1,000,000 Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, To Fund The Capital Improvement Program For The Two Fiscal Years 2024 And 2025
1075.description: Authorizes the city of Pawtucket to issue up to $1,000,000 general obligation bonds, notes and other indebtedness to finance the planning, evaluation, design, construction, equipping and reconstruction of the sewer and sanitation system.

1076.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Provide For The Renovation, Construction, Reconstruction And Equipping Of Public Recreation Facilities In The City Including Land Acquisition And Authorizing The Financing Thereof, Including The Issue Of Not More Than $4,100,000 Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, To Fund The Capital Improvement Program For The Two Fiscal Years 2024 And 2025
1076.description: Authorizes the city of Pawtucket to issue not more than $4,100,000 general obligation bonds, notes and other evidences of indebtedness to finance the construction, renovation, construction, reconstruction and equipping of public recreation facilities.

1077.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Provide For The Construction, Reconstruction And Repair Of Bridges And All Costs Incidental Or Related Thereto And Authorizing The Financing Thereof, Including The Issue Of Not More Than $1,000,000 Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, To Fund The Capital Improvement Program For The Two Fiscal Years 2024 And 2025
1077.description: Authorizes the city of Pawtucket to issue not more than $1,000,000 general obligation bonds, notes and other evidences of indebtedness to finance the construction, reconstruction and repair of bridges and all costs incidental or related thereto.

1078.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Provide For The Improvement And Replacement Of Road Safety Improvements And Traffic Control Devices In The City Of Pawtucket And Authorizing The Financing Thereof, Including The Issue Of Not More Than $1,000,000 Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, To Fund The Capital Improvement Program For The Two Fiscal Years 2024 And 2025
1078.description: Authorizes the city of Pawtucket to issue not more than $1,000,000 general obligation bonds, notes and other evidences of indebtedness to finance the improvement and replacement of road safety improvements and traffic control devices in the city.

1079.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1079.title: Relating To Fish And Wildlife – Aquaculture
1079.description: Requires all aquaculture leases granted by the coastal resources management council (CRMC) to be located at least one thousand feet (1,000') from the median high tide/tide line.

1081.title: Suspension And Revocation Of Licenses --violations
1081.description: Reduces the civil penalty for the first and second offenses for driving without a license or driving with a suspended license, and would make a third violation a civil offense and a fourth offense a misdemeanor punishable by a fine.

1083.title: Registration Of Commercial Fishing Vehicles
1083.description: Requires the division of motor vehicles to develop a form for registration of and a license plate for commercial fishing motor vehicles.

1086.title: Relating To Authorizing The Amendment Of The Warwick City Charter Regarding New Elected Term Lengths And Term Limits For Mayor And Council Elective Terms Commencing January, 2025
1086.description: Approves Warwick city charter amendments increasing mayor's term of office from 2 to 4 yrs, limited to 2 consecutive terms limiting council members to 6 consecutive 2 yr. terms effective 1/1/25 subject to general/special election voter approval.

1087.title: Authorizing The Town Of Middletown To Issue Not To Exceed $235,000,000 General Obligation Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness To Finance The Construction, Renovation, Improvement, Alteration, Repair, Landscaping, Furnishing And Equipping Of New Elementary, Middle And High Schools And School Facilities Throughout The Town, And All Attendant Expenses Including, But Not Limited To, Demolition, Engineering And Architectural Costs; Provided That, The Authorization Shall Be Reduced By The Amount Of Certain Grants Received From State Bond Proceeds, From The Rhode Island Department Of Education Or From The Rhode Island School Building Authority
1087.description: Authorizing The Town Of Middletown To Issue Not To Exceed $235,000,000 General Obligation Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness To Finance The Construction, Renovation, Improvement, Alteration, Repair, Landscaping, Furnishing And Equipping Of New Elementary, Middle And High Schools And School Facilities Throughout The Town, And All Attendant Expenses Including, But Not Limited To, Demolition, Engineering And Architectural Costs; Provided That, The Authorization Shall Be Reduced By The Amount Of Certain Grants Received From State Bond Proceeds, From The Rhode Island Department Of Education Or From The Rhode Island School Building Authority

1088.title: Rhode Island Program To Address Alzheimer's Disease
1088.description: Amends the composition of the Advisory Council on Alzheimers Disease Research and Treatment" to include 6 additional members and renames the council the "Advisory Council on Alzheimers Disease and Related Disorders."

1089.title: Workers' Compensation
1089.description: This act is the annual workers' compensation omnibus.

1091.title: Authorizing The City Of Newport And Town Of Middletown To Establish A Regional School District And Providing For State Aid For School Housing Costs At School Housing Reimbursement Rates For Regional School Districts Which, Including Incentives, May Exceed 80% Of Debt Service For Expenditures Eligible For State Aid
1091.description: Authorizes the city of Newport and the town of Middletown to establish a regional school district.

1094.title: Authorizing The City Of East Providence To Finance The Construction, Renovation, Improvement, Alteration, Repair, Furnishing And Equipping Of Schools And School Facilities In The City By The Issuance Of Not More Than $148,000,000 Bonds, Notes And/or Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, Subject To Approval Of State Housing Aid At A Reimbursement Rate Or State Share Ratio Of Not Less Than 48.5% For Expenditures Eligible For State Aid And Provided That The Authorization Shall Be Reduced By Any Grant Received From The School Building Authority Capital Fund
1094.description: Authorizes the City of East Providence to issue bonds and notes in an amount not exceeding $148,000,000 to finance the construction, renovation, improvement, alteration, repair furnishing and equipping of schools and school facilities.

1095.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1095.title: The Medicaid Reentry Act
1095.description: Mandates that a person's incarceration not affect his or her enrollment status in medical assistance.

1099.title: Relating To Authorizing The Town Of North Providence To Establish, Adopt, And Reapportion The Town Council Voting Districts
1099.description: Authorizes and ratifies the action of the North Providence town council which reapportioned and redistricted three (3) voting districts based on the most recent federal decennial census.

1100.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of East Passage Estates Lot Owners' Association
1100.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of East Passage Estates Lot Owners' Association

1102.last_action: Referred to Senate Health and Human Services
1102.title: Registration Of Nursing Home Patients
1102.description: Due to the COVID-19 health crisis, suspends the provisions of § 36-10-36 relating to reemployment of retired sheriffs and employees of the department of health and the provisions of § 23-17.5-33, relating to monetary penalties, with sunset provisions.

1104.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Environment and Natural Resources
1104.title: High-heat Facility Act Of 2021
1104.description: Prohibits new high-heat waste processing facilities.

1109.title: Hurricane, Storm And Flood Standards
1109.description: Amends dam safety standards to require the state building code standards committee to take into account climate change effect on inundation areas below dams classified as high, significant, or low hazard.

1110.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1110.title: Uniform Control Substances Act
1110.description: Requires that professionals authorized to prescribe opioid drugs discuss addiction risks with the patient or the patient’s parent or guardian if the patient is under eighteen (18) years of age.

1112.title: Rhode Island Uniform Commercial Driver's License Act
1112.description: Eliminates the exemption for firefighters from having to complete a road safety test in order to obtain a commercial driver’s license.

1117.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1117.title: Aquaculture
1117.description: Requires the CRMC Council to conduct a public review and update of regulations/“Red Book,” at least every five (5) years.

1120.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1120.title: Relating To Education
1120.description: Adds direct state support for costs associated with employing school resource officers.

1122.title: Health And Safety Of Pupils-weapons On School Grounds
1122.description: Strengthens school security measures/established 8 member school emergency response committee/rapid response teams/SWAT teams/requires annual appropriation of $1,000,000 to achieve these goals.

1124.title: Relating To Authorizing An Amendment To The North Providence Charter Increasing The Annual Salary Of Members Of The Council, Commencing January 3, 2023
1124.description: Amends the North Providence town charter so that, commencing on January 3, 2023, the annual salary for town council members, increases from eight thousand dollars ($8,000) to fourteen thousand four hundred dollars ($14,400).

1125.title: Authorizing The Town Of North Providence To Establish, Adopt, And Reapportion The Town Council And School Committee Voting Wards
1125.description: Authorizes and ratifies the action of the North Providence town council which reapportions and redistricts its voting wards based on the most recent federal decennial census.

1128.title: Inspection Of Dams And Reservoirs
1128.description: Authorizes DEM to assess penalties for non-compliance with emergency plans for significant/ high hazard dams with DEM/EMA developing system to issue severe weather advisories/watches/warnings.

1129.title: Authorizing The City Of Warwick To Issue Not To Exceed $350,000,000 General Obligation Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness To Finance The Construction, Renovation, Improvement, Alteration, Repair, Landscaping, Furnishing And Equipping Of Two New High Schools And School Facilities To Replace Pilgrim High School And Tollgate High School, And All Attendant Expenses Including, But Not Limited To, Demolition, Engineering And Architectural Costs, Subject To Approval Of State Housing Aid At A Reimbursement Rate Or State Share Ratio Of Not Less Than 45% At The Time Of Issuance And Provided That The Authorization Shall Be Reduced By The Amount Of Certain Grants Received From State Bond Proceeds, From The Rhode Island Department Of Education Or From The Rhode Island School Building Authority
1129.description: Authorizes the city of Warwick to issue up to $350,000,000 general obligation bonds, to finance the construction, renovation, improvement, and equipping of two new high schools and school facilities to replace Pilgrim and Tollgate High School.

1133.title: School Mental Health Act Of 2022
1133.description: Establishes the School Mental Health Act of 2022 which would provide resources and establish a youth advisory council to improve safety in our schools.

1134.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Environment and Natural Resources
1134.title: Rhode Island Greenways Act Of 1995
1134.description: Requires the installation of signs indicating locations of greenway areas

1135.title: The Hospital Conversions Act
1135.description: Requires the transacting parties/new hospital seeking conversion to supply additional information in application for review by the DOH/DAG relating to staffing levels/pension plans/community impact.

1136.title: General Regulatory Provisions--deceptive Trade Practices
1136.description: Amends how credit bureaus doing business in Rhode Island may disclose to inquiring users of credit reports by requiring that in addition to the social security number, the name matches the identity of the person who is the subject of the inquiry.

1138.title: Compulsory Attendance -- See Title 16 Chapter 97 - The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act
1138.description: Provides that the public schools shall be responsible for attendance data monitoring and detection of emergent truant behavior.

1142.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1142.title: Psychiatry Resource Network Funding Act
1142.description: Creates the Rhode Island Psychiatry Resource Network for the primary purpose of equitably determining and collecting assessments for the cost of Psychiatry Resource Network's in the state not covered by other federal or state funding.

1458.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1466.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1467.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1467.title: General Regulatory Provisions - Internet Privacy And Security
1467.description: Establishes that manufacturers of devices capable of connecting to the Internet equip the devices with reasonable security features.

1469.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1469.title: School Committees And Superintendents - See Title 16 Chapter 97 -- The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act
1469.description: Allows a school district to conduct instruction through virtual education up to five (5) days when schools have been closed due to inclement weather, emergency or any nonscheduled school closings.

1471.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1471.description: Restructures professional development investment fund to assume duties of dissemination of curriculum materials/frameworks/assessments/development plans with annual allocation of $200 per student.

1472.title: Student Privacy On School-owned Technology

1483.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1483.title: Public Drinking Water Supply System Protection
1483.description: Requires public drinking water suppliers to utilize technologies to remove PFAS from pubic drinking water supplies.

1485.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1485.description: Prohibits PFAS, a class of fluorinated organic chemicals, from being used in food packaging and requires that any carpeting/clothing manufactured or sold in this state carry a warning label. Violations are punishable by fine of $1000 for each offense.

1487.description: Provides districts with free and reduced lunch populations above 20% have their minimum housing aid share increased to 40% for projects completed after July 1, 2020 and school housing aid ratio increased to 5% if completed by December 30, 2027.

1488.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1488.title: Coastal And Riverine Home Protection
1488.description: Enables cities and towns to provide a tax exemption to individuals who take resiliency measures to rehabilitate their property because of flood hazards.

1493.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
