1493.description: Exempts some incapacitated public service employees who are receiving benefits from the requirement to apply for accidental disability retirement allowances under certain circumstances.

1496.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1496.title: Levy And Assessment Of Local Taxes -- Interest Charges On Overdue Property Tax
1496.description: Establishes a statewide limit of twelve percent (12%) per year on interest charged by cities and towns on delinquent taxes.

1499.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1499.description: Excludes for the purposes of Rhode Island state income taxes, the first $25,000 of eligible military retirement income, paid by the state or federal government to persons 60 years or older received in the 2023 tax year, and thereafter.

1508.description: Requires the health insurance commissioner to adopt a uniform set of medical criteria for prior authorization and create a required form to be used by a health insurer.

1513.last_action: Referred to House Health & Human Services

1514.description: Requires coverage for residential/inpatient mental health services for detox/stabilization/substance abuse disorders without preauthorization or be subject to concurrent review during the first 28 days.

1517.description: Provides that nonprofit dental service corporations shall have the power to provide for the administering and/or insuring of vision and optometric programs.

1529.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1529.description: Only protective orders issued against adults are to be transmitted to A.G.'s B.C.I. for inclusion in the R.O.N.C.O. system. Protective orders against juveniles will be accessible to law enforcement.

1530.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1530.description: SEE TITLE 16 CHAPTER 97 -- THE RHODE ISLAND BOARD OF EDUCATION ACT) -- DISCRIMINATION ON THE BASIS OF RACE PROHIBITED (Prohibits discrimination on the basis of race by expanding the definition of race to include traits historically associated with race, including, but not limited to, hair texture and protective hairstyles.

1532.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1533.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1535.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1535.title: Litter Control And Recycling
1535.description: Prohibits littering upon private property owned by another person.

1536.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1536.description: Repeals health services council and expands the health services and amends several provisions relative to the review process of the hospital conversion act pertaining to maintenance of services and required disclosures.

1542.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1542.description: Repeals the provision of the general laws declaring prisoners serving a life sentence civilly dead.

1544.description: Limits the governor to one thirty (30) day renewal of a declaration of emergency without a joint resolution of the general assembly.

1567.title: Small Businesses -- Zoning Ordinances

1568.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1593.title: Holidays And Days Of Special Observance -- September 11 Classroom Moment Of Silence

1600.last_action: Referred to House Environment and Natural Resources

1693.title: Establishing A Class Size Maximum For Kindergarten Through Grade Two
1693.description: 2) (Mandates public school classroom size be limited to twenty (20) students for kindergarten through grade two (2).

1704.description: Imposes an adaption fee on every barrel of petroleum products and asphalt products received at a marine terminal within this state.

1768.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Special Legislation and Veterans Affairs

1777.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1779.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1793.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1811.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1811.description: Amends the general laws with respect to the operation of bicycles on state highways.

1816.title: Organization Of State Employees
1816.description: Requires that if state employee unions are engaged in contract negotiations and/or utilizing the dispute resolution process, all terms and conditions in the collective bargaining agreement shall continue to remain in effect.

1821.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1821.description: Requires all executive branch agencies and departments to establish and administer a teleworking program to allow their employees to work at a different location, than their ordinary principal work location.

1834.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1834.title: General Regulatory Provisions-consumer Protection From Mandated Indemnified
1834.description: LIABILITY-FREE) PRODUCTS (Prohibits mandating indemnified products to consumers in certain circumstances.

1836.last_action: Committee recommended Substitute A be held for further study

1841.description: Enables parents to review public school learning materials/object if the parent decides that the material is harmful. Also a parent may withdraw their student from the activity or class where the material is used and request an alternative assignment.

1850.description: Allows members of the retirement system who served in the national guard or reserves and who qualify as veterans to purchase retirement service credits.

1861.description: Provides that dental services rendered to patients in Rhode Island shall be governed by Rhode Island law.

1871.last_action: Referred to House Municipal Government & Housing
1871.title: Municipal Partnerships With Water Suppliers
1871.description: Requires municipalities to cooperate and forge partnerships with water suppliers, within their jurisdiction, that assist or enable water suppliers to maintain, improve, backup and safeguard their water supply.

1872.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1872.description: Qualifies mobile and manufactured homes as affordable housing when installed and affixed in mobile and manufactured home parks in groups of twenty (20) or more for a year or more.

1889.title: Video-lottery Games, Table Games And Sports Wagering

1892.description: Categorizes women by their biological identity at birth rather than their gender identity for purpose of organized sports.

1901.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1915.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1915.title: Procedure Generally -- Writs, Summons And Process -- Certification Of Constables
1915.description: Establishes fines and penalties and revocation of license for constables found in violation of rules and regulations.

1916.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1921.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1927.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1930.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1940.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Health and Human Services

1942.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Housing and Municipal Government

1960.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1962.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (04/06/2022)
1962.title: Organic Waste Recycling
1962.description: Requires the department of environmental management, no later than January 1, 2024, to approve and begin implementing that comprehensive strategy to reduce emissions of short-lived climate pollutants.

1964.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1964.title: Just Transition To Clean Energy
1964.description: Establishes just transition office assisted by 18 member advisory committee within DLT to support displaced fossil fuel workers in transition to carbon free economy.

1967.title: Education Freedom Account Program
1967.description: Establishes a new program where the per pupil funding, calculated annually by RIDE, would be transferred into a newly created educational funding account run by the children's scholarship fund to pay for educational expenses.

1981.title: Rhode Island Works Program
1981.description: Exempts the receipt of child support from being treated as earned income for purposes of Rhode Island Children Works' Program benefits.

1984.title: Psychology Interjurisdictional Compact
1984.description: Authorizes governor to enter into Psychology Interjurisdictional Compact and designates office to administer compact. Creates interstate agreement that allows limited telepsychological practice to be conducted across state lines among member states.

1989.title: The Hospital Conversion Act
1989.description: Provides a one year moratorium on hospital conversions involving for-profit corporations as acquiree or acquiror.

1991.title: Corrections Department
1991.description: Establishes a program within the adult correctional institution to permit medication assisted treatment approved by the FDA for the treatment of a substance abuse disorder to any individual incarcerated.

2001.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2001.title: Community Opportunity To Purchase Act
2001.description: Grants a right-of-first-refusal to qualified nonprofits for the purchase of certain multifamily properties.

2014.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2014.title: Mail Ballots--voting
2014.description: Makes it easier for eligible incarcerated inmates to vote and creates the title of a "jail voting coordinator" within the department of corrections to help facilitate inmate voting from start to finish.

2035.title: Relating Criminal Procedure -- Sentence And Execution
2035.description: Requires court to release defendant who is violator of probation on personal recognizance unless reasonable surety is required or unless a crime of violence under § 11-47-2(5) or a crime of domestic violence under § 12-29-2.

2045.title: Registration Of Vehicles -- Registration Of Commercial Fishing Vehicles
2045.description: Requires the division of motor vehicles to develop a form for registration of and a license plate for commercial fishing motor vehicles.

2052.title: Courts -- Justices Of Supreme, Superior, And Family Courts -- Traffic Tribunal
2052.description: Allows magistrates of the traffic tribunal to receive all credits and retirement allowances as afforded to justices and judges of the supreme, superior, family and district courts. Effective June 30, 2022.

2053.last_action: Referred to House State Government & Elections
2053.title: The Office Of Early Childhood Development And Learning
2053.description: Establishes the office of early childhood development and learning to manage a statewide early learning system for children from birth through age five (5), and ensure all children enter school ready to learn.

2054.title: Early Learning Hubs
2054.description: Establishes "early learning hubs" to serve as an intermediary among regional partners in order to coordinate support for early learning providers in the delivery of early childhood care and education.

2055.title: Rhode Island Pre-kindergarten Education Act
2055.description: Creates public, high quality pre-kindergarten education programs which are available to all children ages three (3) and four (4) throughout Rhode Island to increase children’s school readiness.

2058.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2058.title: Public Utilities Commission -- Social Cost Of Carbon
2058.description: Requires the public utilities commission to establish a social cost of carbon and factor it a cost benefit analysis whenever programs are proposed to curb climate change and carbon dioxide emission.

2064.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2064.title: Multi-state Medium And Heavy-duty Zero-emission Vehicle Act
2064.description: Strives to make sales of all new medium and heavy-duty vehicles in the state zero-emissions by no later than 2050.

2067.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2067.title: Advance Instruction For Mental Health Treatment
2067.description: Allows an individual to exercise their right to consent to or refuse mental health treatment through an advance instruction when the individual lacks sufficient understanding or capacity to make or communicate mental health treatment decisions.

2069.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2069.title: Accident And Sickness Insurance Policies--dental Insurance
2069.description: Expands dental insurance coverage, prohibits certain deductions and requires coverage where there is a pre-existing conditions or any earlier treatments. Annual reports must be publicized and filed with the department of health.

2080.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2080.title: Access To Public Records--police Internal Affairs Investigations
2080.description: Classifies any reports of investigations conducted by internal affairs units or their equivalent as public records with certain redactions allowed to prevent a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy.

2084.title: Environmental Justice Focus Areas
2084.description: Establishes environmental justice focus areas/coastal zones and establishes procedures for investigation/ remediation of contaminated sites within coastal zones by DEM with increased community participation.

2087.title: Environmental Justice Impact Statements
2087.description: Require that DEM, require an environmental justice impact statement for a new facility or for the expansion or the renewal of an existing facility's, if the facility is in an overburdened community.

2098.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2098.title: Net-metering--multi-tenant Property Renewable Credits
2098.description: Allows a property owner with eligible net-metering systems with a master meter to allocate excess net metering credits to any meter on the property.

2100.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2100.title: General Regulatory Provisions--surcharges On Credit Card Transactions
2100.description: Provides that surcharges on credit card transactions may only be permitted when certain notice requirements are adhered to and provides for a misdemeanor penalty of five hundred dollars ($500) and/or one year in jail in any violations.

2114.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Environment and Agriculture
2114.title: Rhode Island Climate Corps
2114.description: Creation of RI Climate Corps to implement a work program developed and administered by ServeRI.

2121.title: Real Estate Conveyance Tax
2121.description: Taxes property not considered a primary residence at a flat rate of five percent (5%) of the assess value.

2177.title: Real Jobs Rhode Island Act
2177.description: Establishes a real job Rhode Island program, which is an industry-led system to advance the skills of the state's workforce to grow the state's economy and increase sustainable employment for middle-class families.

2178.title: Employment Security -- General Provisions
2178.description: Extends until June 30, 2023, an increase in the total amount of earnings a partial-unemployment insurance claimant can receive before being entirely disqualified for unemployment insurance benefits.

2181.title: State Lottery--lottery Sales Agent Renewal Period
2181.description: Extends the renewal period for lottery sales agent's license from one year to two (2) years.

2185.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2185.title: Public-private Partnership Infrastructure Program
2185.description: Establishes a seven (7) member public-private partnership infrastructure oversight commission to approve all requests for proposals submitted for public-private partnership construction of qualified facilities.

2186.title: To Authorize And Approve A Referendum To Be Submitted To The Qualified Electors Of The State Of Rhode Island At The Next General Election To Allow The State Of Rhode Island To Issue General Obligation Bonds, Refunding Bonds, And/or Temporary Notes In An Amount Not To Exceed Twelve Million Dollars
2186.description: $12,000,000) FOR THE NEW CONSTRUCTION OF A STATE-OF-THE-ART CARBON-NEUTRAL EDUCATION CENTER AND EVENT PAVILION AT ROGER WILLIAMS PARK ZOO. (Allows the state to issue bonds, and/or temporary notes in an amount not to exceed ($23,500,000) for the new construction of a state-of-the-art carbon-neutral education center and event pavilion at Roger Williams Park Zoo.

2194.title: Electronic Book Licenses To Libraries And Schools
2194.description: Requires publishers to provide electronic book licenses to libraries and schools on reasonable terms, when a publisher offers to license electronic books and digital audiobooks to the public in Rhode Island.

2195.last_action: Committee recommended Substitute A be held for further study
2195.title: Department Of Environmental Management
2195.description: Creates state and local requirements for the protection and preservation of old growth forests located on public lands.

2200.title: Retirement System -- Contributions Benefits
2200.description: Members and/or beneficiaries that retired on or before June 30, 2012 would get two percent (2%) benefit adjustment when benefit adjustments are suspended.

2202.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2202.title: Relation To Taxation -- Business Corporation Tax
2202.description: Increases the amount each corporation pays on state tax to seven and one half percent (7.5%) of net income beginning on or after January 1, 2023, and reduce the minimum tax to two hundred dollars ($200).

2204.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2204.title: Podiatrists
2204.description: Allows licensed podiatrists to administer botox injections.

2211.title: Courts -- Justices Of Supreme, Superior, And Family Courts
2211.description: Provides for a cost-of-living allowance for all present and former state employees

2213.title: State Funds
2213.description: Adds the Workers' Compensation Administrative Fund, Rhode Island Uninsured Employers Fund and the Rhode Island Uninsured Protection Fund to those restricted receipt accounts not subject to indirect cost recoveries.

2216.title: Property Subject To Taxation--city Of Woonsocket
2216.description: Authorizes city of Woonsocket to extend exemption or stabilizing of taxes on qualifying property located in designated districts in the city to 20 years to facilitate economic development within the city. The current law provides for a 10 year period.

2228.title: Federal Old-age And Survivors' Insurance
2228.description: Requires municipalities to ensure that school district employees are eligible for social security.

2229.title: Personal Income Tax--capital Gains
2229.description: Amends the capital gains tax rates and holding period from 5 years to 1 year. Imposes a non-owner occupied tax on homes assessed at more than $1,000,000. Increases estate tax exemption to $2,225,000.

2233.title: Rhode Island Health Benefit Exchange
2233.description: Establishes a premium payment program to help individuals and families transition from expired COVID-19 Medicaid coverage to commercial health insurance, thereby avoiding a gap in medical coverage.

2238.title: Operators' And Chauffeurs' Licenses -- School Bus Driver Training
2238.description: Requires, in order to maintain their certifications, that school bus drivers to pass written state examinations once every ten (10) years, instead of annually, as the current law requires.

2254.title: Appropriations -- American Recovery Program Act Housing Fund And Creating Reliable Efficient Affordable Tenancies Expeditiously -- "create" Homes Act
2254.description: Creates a new department of housing, a housing development fund, and a housing land bank program to help create reliable, efficient, affordable tenancies.

2259.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Mp Cleaning Co. Inc.
2259.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Mp Cleaning Co. Inc.

2261.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2261.title: The Rhode Island Educational Records Bill Of Rights
2261.description: Authorizes local education agency (LEA) to supply a community-based organization (CBO), with individual-level student data, provided certain criteria are met.

2269.title: In Amendment Of Section 4 Of Chapter 1321 Of The Public Laws, 1915, Entitled "fixing The Time For The Election Of Officers In The Town Of Scituate" As Previously Amended By Chapter 3777 Of The Public Laws Of 1956 And Authorizing The Town Of Scituate To Change The Date Of Its Fiscal Year And Allowing The Tax Levy For A Transitional Fiscal Year To Exceed The Maximum Set Forth In § 44-5-2.
2269.description: Changes the annual financial town meeting date for Town of Scituate to the first Tuesday in the month of June starting in the calendar year 2024.

2287.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2287.title: Burial Of Veterans -- Hmong Laotian Guerilla Units
2287.description: Provides certain benefits to members of the Hmong Laotian special guerilla units who served in the secret war in the Kingdom of Laos during the Vietnam War in conjunction with the United States armed forces as granted to Rhode Island veterans.

2292.title: The Rhode Island All-payer Health Care Payment Reform Act
2292.description: Establishes the Health Spending Accountability and Transparency Act and the Rhode Island All-Payer Health Care Payment Reform Act.

2295.title: Retail Sales
2295.description: Authorizes the Providence board of licenses to exempt from the provisions of this section any proposed retailer Class B or Class BV licenses located at 371 Smith Street, Plat 68, Lot 2 of the applicable Providence tax assessment map.

2298.title: Authorizing The City Of Warwick To Issue Not To Exceed $350,000,000 General Obligation Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness To Finance The Construction, Renovation, Improvement, Alternation, Repair, Landscaping, Furnishing And Equipping Of Two New High Schools And School Facilities To Replace Pilgrim High School And Tollgate High School, And All Attendant Expenses Including, But Not Limited To, Demolition, Engineering And Architectural Costs, Subject To Approval Of State Housing Aid At A Reimbursement Rate Or State Share Ratio Of Not Less Than 45% At The Time Of Issuance And Provided That The Authorization Shall Be Reduced By The Amount Of Certain Grants Received From State Bond Proceeds, From The Rhode Island Department Of Education Or From The Rhode Island School Building Authority
2298.description: Authorizes the city of Warwick to issue up to $350,000,000 general obligation bonds, to finance the construction, renovation, improvement, and equipping of two new high schools and school facilities to replace Pilgrim and Tollgate High School.

2300.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Housing and Municipal Government
2300.title: Narragansett Bay Commission
2300.description: Allows the Narragansett Bay Commission to engage in public purpose projects that will have a positive impact on the economic, environmental, and social welfare of Rhode Island.
